Reviews.Title: “Last minute check in on Labor Day weekend”
Reviews.Author: Madison7_12
Reviews.Content: We went to Ocean City Maryland we thought for a day trip, Seems are car had an issue and we had to find a hotel for the night, Mind you it is Labor day weekend, and we had brought our 2 year old grand daughter, I have stayed at the Days Inn on mothers day weekend, and decided to give them a call first to see if they had any rooms last minute, They were so helpful and got us a room at a great price, the room was clean and it was ocean side on top of that, The people at the desk were so happy to help us and made sure we got to the room, 2 pools and near everything we needed. Bathroom very clean with plenty of towels, Room was very clean as well. private balances off your room that lead you right to the board walk. So we stayed the night and my grand daughter just loved it as well. Thank you Days Inn for everything. I know we will be back again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Days Inn EVER”
Reviews.Author: NYtravler49
Reviews.Content: Been coming to OC for years (10+) decided to try a different hotel / location. Wish I would have stayed home after staying at this Days Inn. Rooms are run down & need updating. Bathroom was full of mold & stains on the walls. Also very small. AC unit barely worked (seemed better after I took the filter out & cleaned MYSELF). Blinds on the windows were broken. By the 3rd day I started to notice ANTS in the room. Place is Overpriced I could have rented a condo for what I paid here. DO NOT STAY HERE do a little looking around & price comparison you'll be able to get something much much better for you money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and a great location... Courteous staff, especially Gary at the front desk.”
Reviews.Author: Candicesef
Reviews.Content: Our room was Great and what ever questions we has the manager Gary was able to help with everything! The cleaning staff is also very polite and helped us with everything we needed!!! great stay!!!! A++++

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: GoingToAruba24
Reviews.Content: This was the most disgusting dirty hotel I have ever stayed in. If you have to stay in the "French Quarters" run far, far away. Our room was literally on the street next to the bar, had random people hanging out on our stoop. Everything was dirty, mildew all over the shower curtain, cleaning staff did not clean, dirty mattress, very wet carpet from the second we checked in. We slept in our beach towels because the bedding was so disgusting. We tried to find another hotel, and would have moved if there were any other available. Stay away from this hotel. I have never written a review about any hotels, this one deserved a review. Terrible doesn't even describe this experience. When I checked out, I mentioned these complaints to the Days Inn Employee and he agreed that it should be knocked down.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn, Bus Trip, Oceanfront ,Bottom Floor, room s123,”
Reviews.Author: Jerry F
Reviews.Content: August 19 to the 24th. Welcome party when me and my son got off the bus. They gave us cheese slices and cold pop and our door card to enter room which was very thoughtful. They even had a guy deliver our luggage to our room.Wow We had breakfast every morning and very good. We were in the heated pool every day and it was spotless. The court yard was beautiful with flowers and pine trees and a fountain with brick walk path and gates around. Front desk was very helpful for finding a post office and getting logged in to internet. They had vending machines, ice machines, and bike rentals were 2 streets away. There is maid service but i kept the do not disturb sign on my door the whole 5 days. They put extra towels on the door knob and i told the maid thank you. A guy was pushing a sweeper every day trying to keep parking lot clean. Ice cream and 24 hr coffee shop was 1 hotel away.Internet worked everyday. Rooms were great for 2 people 4 people would be a little cramped. Bathroom was small but big shower made up for that. Bathroom very clean, tile floor and glass block window. New microwave, fridge, flat screen television, Mattress, air conditioner, sliding glass doors with 2 locks, lounge chairs, safe in closet. Big dresser and table and chairs were decent shape. I slept very well every night i was there. Honesty the only bad thing was the carpeting and i found out that the people that sealed the driveway was to blame for that not Days inn. Wear slippers thats what i did. From the minute i got there to the minute we left Days Inn made my vacation the very best. I would return in a heart beat and have a wonderful time. The hotel is not perfect but great enough for me and I'm a clean freak. When i go on vacation i take with me Pine sol, air freshener, Ant spray, baggie for remote and i won't let anything ruin my vacation. Adelina was the maid and she had our room spotless when when we arrived and she was very polite like everybody at Days Inn. Thanks for reading and sorry for being so long but that was my first Ocean vacation in 10 yrs and we will be back here at Days Inn guaranteed. Jerry

Reviews.Title: “EEKK - you can fill in the blank!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jackson0006
Reviews.Content: Old hotel - needs to be shut down to be exterminated and totally cleaned - will never frequent again! The front desk staff and the other workers were very accommodating. However, during the off-peak season, I hope they will use the time to COMPLETELY clean this place. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn Oceanfront Ocean City, MD.”
Reviews.Author: wcsd4090
Reviews.Content: We had spent approx. 6 and a half hours on the road to get here and just wanted to stretch out for a little while as soon as we arrived. Check in is at 3 pm. and we did not arrive until 5:30 pm. We checked in, got our room keys, took our luggage to the room only to find dirty towels all over the bathroom floor, beds not changed, the room was a mess!! Went back to the office to complain, they did clean the room right away and apoligized, but never offered us anything at all to make up for it. The beds were in old, bad shape. Right after that we noticed how the extremely small bathroom smelled terribly like mold. We kept having to run the exhaust fan and spray Lysol all the time! Housekeeping would forget to leave clean towels. For the money we spent on that room, it wasn't worth it and we'll never stay there again!!! Don't waste your time or money on this dump!

Reviews.Title: “Scammers”
Reviews.Author: oceancoleen
Reviews.Content: To anyone thinking of staying there be careful someone let someone stay in the room we had after we checked out and charged it to my credit card. Let's just say LAW SUIT. Spent over 25minutes on the phone with management after they failed to return my first phone call. I had to call Days Inn customer service and hopefully will get this straightened out. Will go back to Ocean City but definately not stay at Days Inn Boardwalk

Reviews.Title: “Deception at Its Finest!!”
Reviews.Author: cgoings
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other Days Inn’s previously and have never experienced a place as appalling as this one. It seemed like the company purchased a dilapidated property and made the most minimal upgrades just to charge an outrageous price because it is on the boardwalk. The deception comes into play because the pictures the company shows of the room is actually the ocean view suite. The only picture they show of the crappy room that I was in was the bathroom. Speaking of the bathroom, I have never seen a toilet seat so low in my life. I have arthritis in both knees and I literally had to squat to use it (sorry if I offended anyone for being too graphic) because it was so painful. I also noticed a number of doors were hard to close and you literally had to slam the doors to shut them. Also, one day the maid never cleaned the shower because the hair ball I left there was in the same place. In addition, you could tell they never clean the carpet because every time I put on clean socks and walked across the floor, it looked like I had walked in a pile of dirt. If anyone decides to stay at this establishment I would recommend only the ocean view suite.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Ken K
Reviews.Content: $400/Day for this? We stayed Aug 6-10 2012 fifth floor ocean side. Entrance door wont open all the way and has to be forced closed to lock; Bathroom door has to be forced closed; A gap of at least 1/2 inch under the entrance door; Air conditioner leaked on the bed and blankets were wet the whole time; Elevator was very hot and slow and door had to be pried open on one occasion; The sliding screen door was out of the track and broken and unusable(room service said ("IT'S BROKEN") DUH no kidding; We had to park a good block from the rooms in the back lot; Refrigerator leaked water constantly and room service said " they all do that"(In other words "GET OVER IT"); Our room had a door to the adjoining room which didn't lock and room service said they fixed it after we called them (WRONG we had to put a chair against it to block it from being opened. The shower is very poor as far as water pressure goes. The only good thing was the view and sound of the ocean. I WILL NEVER STAY AT DAYS INN AGAIN !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; dingy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Princessjam27
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed here on a girls' weekend, the location was great. A really nice low-key bar/restaurant Fish Tales was behind us a street or two; obviously ocean was about 20 steps ahead, Phillip's buffet was a block over; so the location was nice. Not too hectic! The rooms were disappointing. The ceiling was grungy in all the rooms I had been in (4 total). In my particular room, there was water damage, the ceiling was even peeling. The sheet on my bed was stained. The toilet ran all day and night. There was a bulb out in the bathroom. I mean, come on, there are, what?, 4 bulbs around the mirror and they couldn't take the time to replace one. Between my friends and I, I don't think anyone's safe worked either. Then the worst of it all was, the room where I was located was right next to the hotel bar which was actually underground so the sounds traveled up from underneath me then I had to listen to the patrons from the bar screaming and at one point everyone was SCREAMING the happy birthday song; being that at 1:30 I was awake I joined in with them. After all that I was thankful I only booked one night and stayed elsewhere. I also forgot to mention they put my reservation under the wrong name TWICE. However, the gentleman at the lobby desk was quite capable and apologetic. He was great. I felt a little coolness from the female employee. Based on my experience, I will not be returning to this hotel. I will definitely spend the extra money and stay at the Hilton and the like the next time I come to this area. I hope that you have better luck. Request a room on a higher level and get either oceanfront or ocean view. Maybe that will alleviate some issues.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: K P
Reviews.Content: Could not wait to leave. Good location, but disgusting hotel!!!! We stayed in the French Quarters section (the older building). Ants all in the bedding, crawling on us!!! Carpet was stained, gross. Outside of building looked like it should have been condemned. Did not want to touch anything. No elevator access on the side we were in, unless you wanted to go clear to the other end of the building and hallways so small could not get a cart through them. We had a pool view and balcony was gross. So small people had their chairs, towels clogging up the hallways. Workers always running around looking like they had to fix things. Very, very low water pressure. Cold shower. Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: omarfeet
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the days inn oceanfront in the first week of August 2012 for 2 nights. I had an oceanfront first floor. I was shocked when I got there and walked across the carpet once with white socks which turned black. The room smelled bad and the patio stunk of urine. The internet didn't work and got little help from the front desk. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Poolside Efficiency but...Where's the Elevator?!?!”
Reviews.Author: AnnivTripper
Reviews.Content: After checking in to our second floor Poolside Efficiency, we were told there's NO ELEVATOR access! We had to lug all our bags up there ourselves as we waited for a bellman who never showed up. Others, staying on the third floor, were also none too happy to be told there's no elevator service. It was close to 90-degrees and we were melting by the time we got everything hauled up there. I will say, though, the room was quite nice. Bathroom was spotless, which is very important to me. Kitchenette met our needs. Table was a bit unstable and the toaster didn't work, but everything else did. Refrigerator kept everything nice and cold and made plenty of ice. All cookware and table settings were clean and ready to use. A/C worked great and the private balcony was nice for hanging out wet beach towels and bathing suits. Our "room boy" was courteous and eager to please. He quickly found a plug for the kitchen sink when we asked. Bedding for the sleeper sofa was brought up within a few minutes of our call to the front desk. Pool was refreshing and clean with plenty of lounge chairs available. We redeemed our Thrasher's french fry coupon with no problems. Would stay here again but would definitely make arrangements ahead of time for someone to deliver our bags to and from the room.

Reviews.Title: “1st vacation in years”
Reviews.Author: coleen f
Reviews.Content: This was the first vacation my 2children had been on in years, we had a great time pool was great, was promised a room on the 1st floor but stayed on 3rd. Only complaint toilet ran continuously when maintenance came didn't fix problem. But all in all quite even with a large family population. Rooms clean that was all I cared about. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than last time”
Reviews.Author: ILOVERMONT4
Reviews.Content: I will begin with a caveat that my in-laws choose this place every year and I don't argue. Days Inn re-did the floors from 2011. Now the front third of the room is tiled and it is nice. That meant the middle third of the room had new carpeting, maybe? The old carpeting was NASTY! Still, you have to pay the tourist (seasonal) rate if you go in July. The building on the northeast side is three stories but no elevator. There are two flat-screens; not sure the point if there is no sound barrier. Full-size refrigerator and microwave in a tiny kitchette. Two pools that get daily cleaning, thank you! Property is on the boardwalk; very close to the beach but still about 2 miles from the Inlet. WiFi fades in and out. There is NO complementary breakfast. No ants this year -- BONUS!

Reviews.Title: “The management team is great, they accommodated my family when needed.”
Reviews.Author: Zanina241
Reviews.Content: My family came here on Sunday with plans to leave today, but we couldn't. We have to stay a extra night. We love our room on the beach. It's glorious. Thanks for making our stay perfect. This has been a great vacation thanks to Days Inn. Thanks once again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glg G
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the last 5 years, oceanfront is awesome. This time I had a oceanfront suite 5th floor with privacy balcony, location was perfect, room was clean, plenty of towels. The manager Gary Johnson should be commended for what he has done to get this hotel to where it is today comparing to what it was on my first stay many years ago. Looking forward to two more trips before the season is done. I will tip my hat to Mr. Johnson and his staff for their professionalism and quick reaction to my request. I travel a lot throughout the year however I always look forward to my annual retreat to Ocean City to stay at the Days Inn, it's a hidden gem on the boardwalk, away from the noises the beach in front of the hotel always has front row access and not crowded like the lower end of the boardwalk. Also easy access to morning coffee shop and a half a block from the satellite cafe which serves the best stuffed French toast and breakfast foods. People forget this is the beach not Hollywood, everything is not going to be perfect, the focus is the beach, fresh ocean air and sand. I recommend this hotel to many friends who are looking for a beach retreat and they all enjoyed it. Planning my next trip soon.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain dirty!”
Reviews.Author: kittenjd2b
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this place. It has a perfect location - right on the boardwalk. Unfortunately, it was just too dirty to like. When we first arrived, we were given a ground floor room with an ocean view. Though the view was great, I was slightly hesitant about the safety. I immediately called the front desk and asked if there would be any rooms opening up the next day on a higher level. I was told there would be and they would allow us to move. I was happy about that. Then I went in the bath room. There was a lot of hair in it that wasn't mine. My husband walked around in the room for a few minutes in his socks and the once white socks were now black on the bottom! Eeewww! The light switches were FILTHY! There was sand on the bathroom floor. As I realize this is a beachfront motel, I would expect a little sand, but this amount was REDICULOUS! Especially for a room that should have been cleaned between guests. My guess is the room flooded during last year's hurricane that hit Ocean City hard, but they should have replaced the carpet. The next day we did get a new room on the second floor. I refused to walk without shoes in both rooms. My husband walked in socks. Although they didn't get as filthy as they did in the first room there was some dirt on them. The sink in the bath room was very worn. I saw a couple of hairs in the bath that weren't mine. The rooms and bath were both very small. I did like the balcony, although the very low walls between neighbors meant no privacy. Outside our room was a staircase. On our first day on the second level someone either spilled food or regurgitated on a step. For the next two days it just sat there. I watched hotel employees, some of them with the cleaning crew, just walk by it and do nothing! That's why I have to give the service a very poor rating! And that's why I couldn't eat at their restaurant. The whole experience at the motel was very poor. I wouldn't stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: dbnpirate
Reviews.Content: had great time at Days inn, oceanfront, ocean city md. Gary Johnson the manager went beyond the call of duty to make stay great. Though some ups and downs the staff always responded and we always received great service. We received extra towels in five minutes after big rain. I would recomand to everyone, pool is great, staff is great and bar is good.

Reviews.Title: “Service-No! Location-Yes.”
Reviews.Author: Chowess E
Reviews.Content: Asked for extra towels 4 times. Toilet clogged, nobody came after we asked, luckily it was our last day. Left my cell charger there, when they finally sent it a week later, it was the wrong one! The most frustrating thing was that when you call the front desk, you often get an answering machine. What the hell is that? Room was tiny, bathroom not especially clean, not horrible, didn't look like the toilet had been cleaned. Carpet in room very dirty. Kids' socks were black. No sign as to where the check in is, we found it by accident. They seem understaffed. A couple of the front desk people are very nice. DONT leave anything there, or if you do, kiss it goodbye.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Debra Q
Reviews.Content: Arrived for family reunion on 7/9/12-7/13/12, about 2:00pm. Had to wait for our room, when they were ready it seemed no one could tell family members were the elevators were located. We did express our dismay to the general manager, who did upgrade all our family members,as we had multiple rooms for a family reunion. Unfortunately,things went from bad to worse, the rooms were not the cleanest, areas of the hotel had garbage spilling out of garbage cans, we spotted more than one rodent running between rooms, and to top all of this off my nephew and his wife had unexpected visitors enter their hotel room in the middle of the night because the front desk guest rep. apparently did know how to look up which rooms were already in use. We will not be returning to this hotel on the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “worst vacation”
Reviews.Author: porkchop1126
Reviews.Content: my family and i got to OC at noon on july 10, and so we used the pool and went into the ocean, since our room was not ready. We went to get the room at 3pm, all good, we found one of our coolers was missing, no big deal, the kids probly left it out, well we could not find it. Then at six, we get ready to get dinner, and i am looking for my wallet! no wallet to be found, then my 6yr old daughter was looking for her little purse, gone!! we took all in stride, went to the front desk to express our displeasure, really not a good sense of concern, so we did cancell my debit card. So we enjoy the 2 days in OC, and leave on the morning of the 12th, going up to NY, we get to our next destination, to find my wifes wallet is gone!! and find out they emptied our chking account out!!! today is the 14th, and no response from hotel. we got back home late on the 13th, and i will be calling anybody at days inn to express my displeasure with OC hotel, and calling OC police to file a complaint. We will not go to OC again!!!

Reviews.Title: “We were treated with disrespect in the associated restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Robert W
Reviews.Content: We were walking down the boardwalk and needed a rest so we walked into the restaurant in the Days Inn Complex. There was not a sole in the place. We asked if we could sit by the pool. The hostess seated us outside and we ordered a couple of drinks and medium pizza. Even though the menu said they had medium pizza they only had large...hmm...I needed to go to restroom but I could not use the same door we came out of. I had to go in through the front door. The door to the restroom was locked so I asked if there was a key. The hostess said it was only for customers. I said I was a customer and that she had just seated us outside. Another person had to open the restroom for me. Later the pizza came. It was okay. We didn't eat it all so we asked for a box to go. When we were leaving I thought I had better use the restroom again. So I walked back through the front door with my pizza box and asked if I could use the restroom. I set the pizza box down and a person with the key let me in the men's room. When I came out I picked up my pizza box and the hostess grabbed it out of my hands and said I could not have that, "it was not yours." There still wasn't anyone in the restaurant...I said it was mine, and that we had just finished eating outside. During the confrontation my wife came in and the hostess recognized her and said I could have the leftover pizza. We both shook our heads said that was okay we didn't want their pizza and we left. We were treated terrible and we will never, ever go back to that restaurant. We did not stay at the hotel so I can't say anything about that but the way we were treated in the associated restaurant was uncalled for.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, bed bugs, missing ceiling tiles.”
Reviews.Author: greenvegansara
Reviews.Content: 7/2/2012-7/09/2012 After the first night we saw blood streaks on sheets, didn't know why. Travelled all over the world in many hotels, motels etc. Never had bedbugs. The last day my child had bites all over. Looked in bed and found adult bedbugs, and different stages of development. caught them with tweezers and put in a ziploc bag. Manager refunded one night, gave us breakfast and put all of our stuff in a hotroom and steamed our car. But we still took everything to the laundromat and dried it all for an hour. Hoping not to bring them home. We should have known something was up. When we arrived 2 hours after check in the room was still not ready. They said there was a late check out and they had to switch things out. I guess they were trying to treat the room, but it didn't work. The room had missing ceiling tiles, broken phone, ants, and the king size bed had long black hair all in it. Asked for new sheets and were told there were no fitted sheets for king left. We made the bed with queen too sheets. I did look at the mattress edges when we got there and never saw anything. Noticed one bed had a zipped cover on it. Of course I never saw bedbugs but figured if there were any bugs I'd know. I didn't know to look for bug shell casings or black spots. We were in a suite by the pool. 3rd floor # S408

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: rockgirl21661
Reviews.Content: Room was small, and smelled like mildew , my kids socks were black from the carpet....this was a first floor room....maybe it had been flooded????? Never again

Reviews.Title: “The oceanfront room was very nice”
Reviews.Author: somerssalt
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 6/8/12 - 6/11/12, room 147. The room was in the oceanfront building, on the ground floor. It was a handicapped room. I had a private patio and I could step over the concrete wall of my patio, walk across ten feet of grass, and I was on the boardwalk. The air conditioner worked great, the room was clean enough, and the bed was very comfortable. There were six pillows on each bed, which was great. The pool area was clean and the pool itself was sparkling. They had a DJ playing, and a waitress getting drinks (try the Mango Margaritta). The restaurant was a bit pricey for breakfast ($10 for 2eggs, 2pancakes, and 2bacon), but the food was very good. But definately don't get the orange juice (tiny, overpriced and mediocre taste). The hotel wasn't perfect, but I never expect perfection. Plenty of free parking. The office people were friendly and efficient, and definately not understaffed. All-in-all it was a fine place for me and my family for a weekend. I'd go back in a second. Definately not a new place, but in ok shape and in a great location. The non-oceanfront buildings don't look as nice from the outside, but I didn't see their inside.

Reviews.Title: “"Best Available" option a good choice”
Reviews.Author: EK20721
Reviews.Content: Days Inn Oceanfront has a well-managed, superb staff. For an affordable price go the end of May on week days. Missed hair conditioner for after shampooing. Loved the 2 outdoor pools. Thanks Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “days inn is great”
Reviews.Author: barbienj
Reviews.Content: we have always had a great time here, we are booked for july and august also, the manager Dave can not do enough for you,

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again and again”
Reviews.Author: sly1129
Reviews.Content: The ocean front is the best. Days inn didn't have alot of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MarieTodaro
Reviews.Content: They front desk was pleasant. When I got there the room I received was not the room I ask for. I was told it would be took care of and it was. I was upgraded to a oceanfront which was unbelievable. the room was big enough for me and my husband. Thank you to the lady at check in time. Check out was pleasantt also a young man check me out who tool the time to ask if I enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Softball Tournament”
Reviews.Author: Beth C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a softball tournament weekend. The rooms were decent. I wish that there would have been more privacy on the balcony. But the view was great. The big hit was the nice pool area that the girls loved. It was great for hanging out with the team and families. We also got a great group rate!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time. Great View.”
Reviews.Author: Michelle B
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend in O.C. past fall. The view was awesome. Loved the location as it had easy access to entertainment & lots of good restaurants. Room was clean and attractive. Did not need much but staff was very responsive and friendly. Went in prime time before this trip and really enjoyed drinks by the pool :O) It's our "go to" place in Ocean City. Solid value. Michelle B. Rockville, MD

Reviews.Title: “just okay!”
Reviews.Author: TamB_11
Reviews.Content: we got a great deal on our room rates,great balcony and view, but there were nats flying around the bathroom all wknd and the housekeeper did the minmal in daily cleaning!The room was pretty clean when we arrived.The showerhead was broke and only shot out a thin stream.The employees were not friendly at all,when checked out,we were not asked how our stay was(guess they are afraid to ask)Rooms were small.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but not the worst”
Reviews.Author: momoo
Reviews.Content: We were given a complimentary room for this past Saturday night and when we checked it, we were told it was on the first floor on the boardwalk. My husband and I both knew we were in trouble because we both hate first floor rooms. The good: When we opened our door, the room itself was small, but very clean and bright and new. All of the furnishings were fresh and new including the carpeting, It was bright and cheery with 2 double beds, a small fridge and microwave on top and two chairs and a small table. The bad: The bathroom is TINY! I mean.....itty bitty! It is on the sidewalk side of the hotel with a big frosted window that you can actually see through if the lights are on and you're outside walking past. No curtain and I would never take a bath there at night. There were no outlets by the sink for my curling iron, so the cord plugged in next to the door and across the toilet to the sink (about 3 1/2 feet. Bathtub is tiny, and the layout is outdoor wall, toilet,sink,bathtub, wall. About 6 feet total. Then we opened our sliding door to the boardwalk. No screens to leave the door open. Balconies are not private in any direction, and even though the rooms on this floor were all non smoking, the people on the next balcony had at least 10 people there and three of them were smoking so we had to come back in and close our door. And you can't leave your curtains open because everyone who passes by can look right in. The good: We went back to the desk and asked for an upper floor room and the young man working then was very nice and polite and accomodating. He gladly changed our room to the third floor. It was the same small room, oceanfront, The bad: but the balconies have even less privacy on the upper floor. All in all, the rooms were nice, clean, and cheery but very, very small. Convenient if you're looking for a clean hotel on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, excellent deal”
Reviews.Author: tammy_217
Reviews.Content: We had an ocean view room, it was a wonderful scene. Perfectly located so we could walk anywhere. Love this hotel. We are return customers. The room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Days Inn I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: LisaR91011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a King Size Oceanfront room for our honeymoon. First I didnt even get a kingsize room was told there was none available but yet I paid for 1 night up front when I made the reservations. Ended up with a room with 2 double beds..a downgrade from the Queen we have at home. The first room they put us in smelled like mold..I went to go out onto the balcony and the screen door fell off in my hands. We asked for another room and was given one..smelled a little better but still not what you would expect. The carpet was filthy, I was afraid to walk around without shoes..ruined 3 pairs of socks while I was there. no screen door on the balcony, there was hair in the bathtub from whoever stayed there before us. The first morning housekeeping came in and made the bed..period..they didnt replace the towels, or the coffee and there was still hair in the tub. I complained to the front desk and they said "they would take care of it" ok I got clean towels and more coffee but the hair was still there. I ended up cleaning the tub myself..just what I wanted to do on my honeymoon. The water pressure in the shower was non existant..if you are bald its great. The bathroom sink would not drain, my husband even took it apart to see if he could fix it..Hello we should not be doing these things on our honeymoon The front desk clerk claimed to live in OC his whole life but didn't even know what time the on site restaurant was open. which by the way in the 4 days we were there was never open for dinner. The best thing I can say is the view from the balcony was awesome and it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not very close to the amusement pier”
Reviews.Author: Sajanlove
Reviews.Content: The room overall was clean. However, there were ants on the counter. I don't know where they were coming from, but I avoided putting items on it. The pool looked nice, but because I was there for only a day, I was unable to test it. The ocean front view was BEAUTIFUL. I do wish the hotel was closer to the amusement pier. But the distance from it was nice too because it was quiet. If you like to stroll, run, or ride a bike, then it's a good distance. Overall, my stay was a good stay. The only "weird" thing was the 2 tv's in one room. I can understand the reasoning behind it, but it was difficult to hear when you were not watching the same tv station.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Fran G
Reviews.Content: We were scheduled to go to Ocean City with our daughters and it ended up that a hurricane was coming up the coast. I called to cancel and they told me that I couldn't because I was not giving 72 hours notice. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?? How do you give 72 hours notice for a hurricane - the weather channel was not even saying what would happen so I drove over 200 miles to be told I had to leave the following morning. Most of the rooms were not even ready by check-in time and the shower had zero water pressure!!!! Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Donna S
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel, away from the hustle and bustle, but still right on the boardwalk and tram line. The oceanfront rooms have very large balcony...great for enjoying the ocean or people watching on the boardwalk. It was recently renovated and clean. We enjoyed the breakfasts at the on site restaurant. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: greyphoenixx
Reviews.Content: Compared to the nightmare we had just come from in Ocean City this place was 100% times nicer. The room was nice, and ver big for the price. Bed was comfortable and clean. We had our do not disturb on the door the whole time, but housekeeping was very nice taking our trash and getting us new towels when we asked for them. The staff was very friendly and the hotel had 3 pools . One regular pool, and then the other two were on the opposite side of the pool bar which had music playing and there was a kiddie pool which my daughter loved, and we loved the fact their was a server that came around at the pool to see if you wanted anything to eat or drink. Overall, for the price it was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “going back we loved the days inn”
Reviews.Author: Leslie D
Reviews.Content: This will be the third year we returned to days inn ocean city. we meet up with family and always have a blast in ocean city md. we stayed in the F building this year which is next to the family pool area and garden. the room was big and was nice that there was a kitchen area and 2 tvs. we had a partial view of the ocean. the pools were nice and the hotel was overall nice we will definatly be coming back. the building with the square pool is the oldest and not nice at all we stayed in it last year. make sure if you go you stay in the F b uilding above the hotel lobby or the oceanfront building. The other building called the "french quarter" isnt nice and a ripoff the price is expensive even though you face the street and is very old and run down we are definatly going back but not staying in the french quarter building were stayin in the F building or oceanfront if you stay there youll probably be happy with your stay its a nice beach motel

Reviews.Title: “First and last stay”
Reviews.Author: Sassymama22
Reviews.Content: The room had a strong, wet and musty smell to it. There was sand on the floor when we firs checked in... but we were at the beach so we said "oh well". There was a hole/crack between the carpet and hardwood floor with a carpter nail sticking out of it.... very dangerous for anyone to step one. The light over the bathroom sink never came on and the recessed lighting in the bathroom did not have a cover on it, just the bulb sticking out. They claim to have cable but the channels had snow in them. The outside stairwells were dirty with trash and there was not enough parking. Some of the front desk staff were rude and others were just not friendly at all. You could hear any and everything going on outside of your room, any time of the day.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Sue S
Reviews.Content: Just got back and was apprehensive going given the mixed reviews. We had a terrific time! Location was super - on the quiet north end of the Boardwalk. Didn't try the resturant, but the pool was great. We swam in the "family" pool area, but there is a seperate pool for folks who want to swim laps or just don't want to hang out near the kiddie pool. Both have resturant / bar service. The room was older and dated, but for the location it was worth the comprimise. Very clean and housekeeping was more than happy to provide us with extra shampoo and towels. We really enjoyed having a microwave & fridge in the room too. Looking forward to another 4 day get away here next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Amber92056
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a work trip in July, it was my first time to Ocean City, I hope I never have to go back. The carpet in this hotel was disgusting. I ruined a couple pairs of socks while there, I'm glad I brought some so I had something to protect my feet. There was also black mold on the ceiling in the bathroom that should be taken care of. It says the hotel was recently upgraded, not sure what was upgraded but my room was old and dingy. It also smelled like mildew in the room. People can blame that on the humidity but I've stayed in plenty of humid places that down smell like mildew. I believe the price for this hotel was about $230/night. Yes it is oceanfront but everything in Ocean City is. For that price in California you can get a MUCH nicer room in a hotel that's a walk to the beach. The one positive I found was the staff. The manager of the restaurant was extremely pleasant and friendly and the front desk staff was as well.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Services”
Reviews.Author: Kevin B
Reviews.Content: First things first, We enjoyed our stay at the Days Inn Oceanfront very much. The rooms were very nice and clean, the beds were very comfortable and the view of the beach was just perfect. During our stay we had a vew minor issues which came up and I have to tell you, the folks at the front desk were outstanding and resolved my concerns within minutes of me informing them. Customer services is very important to me when staying at a hotel, so I would be remist not to say it was outstanding ! I would recommend this hotel and will be looking forward to staying there again..

Reviews.Title: “So far, so good!”
Reviews.Author: dotnbri1
Reviews.Content: So far, we haven't had any big problems. Location is awesome. It is right on the quieter end of the boardwalk. Beach in this area is very nice and access to it is right in front of the hotel. The pools are very nice, and the courtyard is really pretty. The staff has been helpful. The room is a typical small beach room that you find everywhere. Bathroom was clean. Carpet was dirty, but I haven't been to a beach hotel yet where that wasn't the case. So far, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “location is great, rooms are not”
Reviews.Author: dmdlvr
Reviews.Content: Great location but the rooms are seriously outdated and dingy. Windows in the bathroom are right on the hallway - anyone outside could hear everything, if you know what I mean. Pool and poolside service were good, no waiting but both pool areas were very crowded. Unfortunatley, we left one of our pillows in the room at 10am when we checked out -- called the front desk before Noon to ask someone to retrieve it (stupidly, I had one of my really good pillowcases on it) they said the room wasn't cleaned yet and would send someone to get it. 3hrs later i called back, the same girl (Amanda) didn't know what I was talking about, didnt' remember taking my name and phone number 3 short hours before hand -- anyway, she contacted the head housekeeper and would call me back....no call back that day. I called back the next morning and was told they did not find a pillow in that room, sorry. Service was ok but make sure you don't leave anything behind, it will disappear even if you call immediatley - which I understand they are not responsible for items left behind but when someone calls and is told the room wasn't cleaned yet - how could they not find the item and hold it, extremley disappointed with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Your white socks will magically turn BLACK!”
Reviews.Author: ILOVERMONT4
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm expecting too much for $220/night, but a clean room should be included in the price. The floors/carpeting are absolutely FILTHY!! If you have infants or young children, avoid this place. They may catch a disease -- who knows what's growing among the fibers. My white socks turned black after a day of normal foot traffic inside the room. The housekeeping staff really don't care. All they do is replace the towels and empty the trash; they don't even vacuum (not that that will make a big difference). The building we were in (northwestern side) does not have an elevator, so if you're stuck on the top floor, be prepared to schlep your stuff up and down the stairs. The pools are nice -- they do clean them everyday. The waitresses will come around poolside if you want to order food or drinks. The property is adjacent to the broadwalk so it's a 2 minute walk to the ocean. The Bahia Marina is across the street on the bay side if you want to go fishing or need fishing/crabbing gear. There are also two miniature golf courses within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “3 different stays, 3 different experiences”
Reviews.Author: KathrinMaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love Ocean City. We have been traveling there for the last 5 years every summer. Our first stay at the Days Inn was disappointing. Instead of the Oceanfront Rooms I reserved we received an Oceanview Room with very little view of the Ocean. Upon complaining about it I was just told that there was nothing that could be done. I later complained via e-mail and was promised better treatment the following year. The promise came true and I was given an Oceanfront Room for a lesser price. This year I chose the hotel again, after the good treatment last year just to discover the inconsistency in the hotel. My family came all the way from Germany to spend time with me in Ocean City. I reserved two Oceanfront Rooms again. The room my sister stayed in had the dirty towels from the previous occupants still on the floor. The bathroom was not cleaned at all. My sister got nauseous after trying to dry her hair just to discover unidentifying spots and globs on the dryer. The room stank and had a sinking ceilling from a possible water leak. My rooms bathtub was still dirty. Our TV did not work and we also had bad water damage to look at. It did not help to discover that our hallway was blocked off after out trip to the beach. Somehow an extra bed was brought into our room which we never requested and made movements impossible. Apparently the person really requesting the bed had been waiting for it while the hotel did not know where it was. I did not complain this time since we only stayed one night and my sister informed me of the terrible conditions of the room much later. I will keep that in mind though when I will plan our summer vacation next year.

Reviews.Title: “They were awesome! We will book for next year!”
Reviews.Author: tamjhoo
Reviews.Content: We Were VERY pleased with the experience at Days Inn. We had some problems with a hotel 2 blocks up and inquired at Days Inn. They were extremely accomodating. We absolutely loved our room. It was clean and very spacious. They couldn't have been nicer. The pool was also a pleasant surprise. It wasn't very crowded. It was clean. It was everything we wanted. The complete glass front at the balcony was beautiful. It gave us a wonderful view of the ocean and the boardwalk. I highly recommend this hotel for an overall pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great room would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jreggiannini
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable would stay again maybe just not for a week with 2 growing boys we could have used more room, but all in all it was a good location. we were on the bottom floor, oceanfront step over the wall of the porch and you r on the boardwalk. HAD A GREAT TIME CAN NOT WAIT TO COME BACK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Housekeeping did a good job with the room when we were not there.

Reviews.Title: “Room was small. Overall had a good time.”
Reviews.Author: Liss924
Reviews.Content: Room was very small but we enjoyed our time out doors. Manager Gary was excellent should me a bigger room for next time. I was worried because of other feedback but overall I had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location; GREAT staff; GREAT experience....will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: jjkoconnor
Reviews.Content: The manager and staff assisted with pushing my disabled car. They did not hesitate to assist. The manager is a very caring manager aiming to please guests. We cannot say enough about all the staff we encountered over the three day period. They were all genuinely interested in making sure guests were satisfied with their lodging and surroundings. We cannot say enough good things about the manager, staff and hotel. Will surely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the bunch”
Reviews.Author: theweberclanUS
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a short jaunt to Ocean City. Initially we were only supposed to stay 2 nights, but kept putting off our departure. We stayed at this hotel on the last night and, boy, I wish we'd booked this one first. For a similar price we stayed in and oceanfront studio which was spacious and had fantastic views. When we turne dup they offered us a top notch room at $50 less than the advertised price. It was clean and less noisy than the other hotels we had stayed in. The only negative was there was no indoor pool, which would be nice for the out of season guests, but I think we were allowed to make use of one at the Howard Johnson if we wanted. Our washing machine leaked which would have been irritating if we'd been there for a longer stay. The rooms had been recently refurbished too. All in all, the best of the 3 hotels, and I wish our whole stay had been here.

Reviews.Title: “Uncooperative”
Reviews.Author: Steelie2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for years. Last year was the first year that we had ...well an uncooperative stay. We have always arrived earlier than the check in time and we never expect any special treatment. We arrive early so the kids can enjoy a whole day at the beach or the pool. Well, when we arrived we were told the room is not ready and won't be until check in time ok..... When I made the reservations (2 rooms) I had requested that we be put back in the same room we have had in all the years past. My mother needed a handicap room. When we arrived they were placing us not on the first floor like we have had (and I might add I placed these reservations in January for a June stay). They were not giving my mother a handicap room. We weren't pleased at all with the way the gentleman at the front desk handled this situation. We however were able to talk to the manager and he placed both rooms on the first floor, and my mothers room was not handicapped. So to start the vacation we had a bad taste. Finally, able to get to the rooms and not at all what I expected, (we have stayed for years). The rooms were starting to fall apart, they were somewhat dirty and the air cond. did not work correctly. Both rooms had this problem. The fridge in our room did not get cold, the replaced it, after hours of complaining!!! We had brought food that needed to be in the fridge. I have to say I was very glad when we were done with this vacation. After all the hard work we had to do to get to go on a family vacation with the economy the way it is. Now, another year another vacation to schedule. I vote not to go back in fact not even to go to Ocean City after the bad taste last vacation left. When I went online to look for a new vacation, Days Inn was offering a wonderful to good to be true special!!! 25% if booked by a certain date, of course I took advantage of this and booked our vacation again months before June, In fact it still isn't June. I told the girl I booked it with that she was the only reason I was even coming back, she however, is the best person in the whole place. I then continued looking on the computer for a great deal elsewhere, not truly convinvced that things were going to be any better this year. I FOUND A GREAT DEAL elsewhere, you just have to keep looking. I then called to cancel my reservation, You know you have to send your deposit for your reservation within 10 days and that I did!!! if you don't follow the rules you won't have a room. So when I cancelled the resv. I was told the refund checks are only written on Fridays, I should have my refund in a couple weeks. I said I am cancelling my reserv on a Wed. why wouldn't it be written that Friday, I was told that is just the way it is. So needless to say a couple weeks went by and still not check. I called again, was told the same thing, checks will be written on Friday, more time has passed NO REFUND!!! I called again, and I asked what the status of my refund was, they put me on hold and said they spoke with corporate and they said they write checks on Friday!!!! I then asked the person I was speaking with to let me speak with a manager or could they give me corporates number I was told NO on both accounts. I said to the girl that I needed to get this problem resolved. I asked if she could give my number to corporate and have them call me back, she said no they don't do that. I asked her what I was supposed to do, I am getting nowhere and I don't have my refund. She then got very nasty and I mean nasty with me. I told her there had to be someone who was in charge, if I had to I would contact Days Inn main office, she said go ahead, we're privately owned and there is nothing they can do about it. I told her that I would make sure that everyone, would hear about this uncooperative way of doing business. She said how would you do that, I told her I would Facebook, put it on Trip Adv. and tell as many people as I could. So I did contact Days Inn complaint dept. they did register a complaint and told me that I should hear by the end of the week. However, they're privately owned and that complaint may not get me anywhere. Wanted everyone to know if this is happening to me, it could happen to you!!!! RETHINK your stay at the DAYS INN OCEANFRONT OCEAN CITY MD they don't stand behind Days Inns name. I am very sad this happened this was a great location and price!!!! But noone deserves to be treated like that!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Achor restuarant BLOWS”
Reviews.Author: hittman61
Reviews.Content: We can't say anything about the hotel but this was the only way that we could warn you about the independantly owned restaurant. IT SUCKS. We went there for breakfast, I ordered the 2 egg breakfast/over med eggs/hashbrowns and sausage. My wife Hash browns with onions and a fruit salad with cranberry juice. The eggs were disgusting, burnt (badly) and almost hard. They do not have hash browns they brought homefries (cold) and I believe the sausage was straight from the box. The juice was sent back after a long english lesson that obviously failed. I would recomend 7-11 before this place.

Reviews.Title: “THIEVES AT DAYS INN”
Reviews.Author: fosterv
Reviews.Content: On August 5th I checked in to Days Inn with four of my girfriends for a girls weeken out.We arrived at the hotel at abourt 7.30 am checked in and went up to the room, as we entered the room WHOA.... IT STUNK OF FRESH CIGARETTE ASHES. We immediately called the front desk who then sent up a guy who smelled just as bad as the room and he sprayed the carpet, the whole time we were there we had to leave the doors open to keep the fresh air in. My main problem was that on checking out I left a bag containing jewelry some unsual pieces two watches necklaces, earrings, bracelets including my wedding rings etc. which weighed about 8lbs total because you know women we need choices, however I left the bag on the bed because we checked out around 3.30 am. I called the front desk informing them that the bag was left on the bed and the manager Jimmy promised to look into it. After a number of calls back and forth he claimed housekeeping did not see it, and that he would check the laundry department, they also claimed they did not see it. giving them the benefit of the doubt I said to him this bag weighed about 8lbs if in fact housekeeping swooped up the sheets on the bed and it went down to the laundry then what happends after you take it out of the washer to the dryer would'nt it then feel the weight or even after drying and you fold dont you think it would have been there. I left these items on the bed and all I can say is that there is a thief or thieves at the DAYS INN ON 2210 BALTIMORE AVENUE OCEAN CITY. Is no way you could not have seen it. I guess this is what you get when you stay at these so called 5 star hotels where they employ people with desperate backgrounds for $3.00 an hour. I have travelled and stayed at many hotels and one experience I remembered I left my personal towel at the MGM GRAND IN LAS VEGAS i informed the front desk when i arrived home and the matter was immediately resolved, my towel was found, and was put in the mail one week later. This is a FIVE STAR HOTEL. GUEST IF YOU NEED A PLACE TO STAY YOU WILL BE SAFER SLEEPING ON THE BOARD WALK. THIS STAY WAS A WASTE OF MONEY AND TIME.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was great and the room was very...”
Reviews.Author: Youbg
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and the room was very clean and housekeeping was always on time. The pool bar was great and the pool had a bit to much chlorine but swimable. Very close to the beach just not at all close to the "fun" busy part of the boardwalk. Overall bathroom clean bed very comfy . Will stay agaib.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst place you could ever stay”
Reviews.Author: kchendrix
Reviews.Content: Our experience there was terrible . Before arriving they had lost our reservations. Trying to make things right they gave us larger rooms at the price of the original room. When we arrived , the rooms smelled bad and were filthy, they said they would give us a choice for two smaller rooms or they would clean this one and comp the room. We went to beach while they cleaned. We came back and stayed the night. I visited the downstairs bar which is supposedly part of the hotel.. I am accustomed to travel and any other affiliated bar at any other hotel I have ever stayed at would let you take your beverage back to the room. When I went to leave , glass in hand they chased me down like a thief and I had to finish my drink right there. Upon check out the next day, they charged our credit card even though they said it was comped. They took the charge off, but then the following day it magically appeared again. So we had to fight over again to get it removed. I would never recommend this place to anyone, it ruined what was to have been a nice two day get-away. Day's In Corporate offices needs to step in to this poorly run facility!

Reviews.Title: “This oceanfront hotel was amazing”
Reviews.Author: mweyant
Reviews.Content: If you are planning on going on a family vacation to OC...this is the place to stay. The hotel is located smack dab on the boardwalk with hop to the sand. Our room was cleaned everyday by 11:00 am and stocked with clean laundries and soaps accordingly. The cleaning staff were very friendly and honest. Would recommend this hotel to everyone. Definitely got the bang for our buck.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: gwenshair
Reviews.Content: days inn is in a good location and we had a great view but the noise from the grand hotel's air conditioning units was so loud that you could not sit outside and enjoy italso the furniture in our studio was dirty and stained but the pull out bed mattress looked brand new

Reviews.Title: “Will stay at this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: beachbum6671
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean spacious rooms, and two pools for the kids. Beds were very comfortable and location is close to all attractions. Nice balcony on ocean front/ocean view rooms.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: rpklinger
Reviews.Content: Our families vacation this year was the best yet. After vacationing at Ocean City for the last 7 years we finally have found the ultimate vacation spot at the Days Inn Oceanfront. The staff of Jim, Richard and Janet was over the top, our room was clean, and the view great. Everything we expected and more. Thank you Days Inn staff for making our family vacation an awesome experience. We'll be back next year.RK

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a great clean friendly hotel to stay at while in OC this is the place for you..”
Reviews.Author: adowlin
Reviews.Content: Upon arival we were greeted by friendly staff that checked us in and showed us to our room.. Our room was more than we expected very nice location looking out over the beach, and very clean.. During our stay we realized we forgot little things, the General Manage (Gary Johnson) had taken my call at the front desk he was more than happy to send a razor and shampoo up to the room for me saving me a trip to the store.... Also the housekeeping staff was very nice and did their job well, they also helped us find things to do in the area. Nothing better than a local giving us information on great places to eat, shop, and find entertainment thanks Duchess....

Reviews.Title: “Far better than a Typical Days Inn... Friendly staff that cares.”
Reviews.Author: KVAfromDC
Reviews.Content: What's not to like?? 2 pools (1 heated), a Pool bar. Directly over the famous Boardwalk with perfect view of the beach. The sfaff was very friendly and attentive - like all top hotels, they make eye contact and greet you as they pass. They had some issues in the past but that was then, this is now. The room was well done right down to the marble tile. I will go back next time I'm in Ocean City, MD.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great view, great service for the price! Thanks, Zach for being an employee that cares!!!!”
Reviews.Author: toniimarie47
Reviews.Content: I would have to say that at first, I was not sure about staying at a Days Inn, but WOW, it was Great! We stayed in the studio, ocean view, boardwalk view and could not have asked for a better room. So, if you are wanting a great place for the price; this is it. I would also have to say that we had one of the most concerned employees working with us; Zach. I am sure they all are, he just happened to be assigned to us. No question about it; this is a great place to stay!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location!”
Reviews.Author: fivewalls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn for the weekend and it was great! We did not move our car once all weekend. Right on the boardwalk so walked everywhere from boardwalk amusements , restaurants, and miniature golf. We had an oceanfront room which had a large balcony with a beautiful view. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Rooms were spacious and clean. Nice pool with bar. Can sit by the pool and have lunch/drinks. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: IlysaM
Reviews.Content: We travelled from the Eastern Shore at the last moment and had never been to Ocean City before. We had no idea what to expect but learned early on that accommodations were expensive and inconvenient to the boardwalk. We finally went to Days Inn, met the friendly front desk people and were shown a couple of rooms which I've never experienced before. The vibes were great, no request was too small and we decided to choose to stay there for 3 nights. Room was clean though small (it was a king bed and there wasn't much room for anything else), flat screen tv was a nice amenity, 2 pools although not olympic size. We often asked for recommendations about where to eat and got great ideas. Location was great -- right in the middle of everything! We want especially to thank RIchard B. who couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating. Every hotel's front desk should have one of him -- especially when we'd already spoken with 6 or 7 other front desk folks to get quotes and had not been terribly impressed. (I was especially not impressed with the front desk at Fenwick Inn who couldn't have been bothered with us.) All in all, a great trip and that trip was made all the more enjoyable by the lovely, accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: TOA031
Reviews.Content: Newly "remodeled" meant fresh paint, carpet, linens, bathrooms - so that part was fine. Beds were very comfortable. BUT....the "bones" of the place was the original - rust and all! Place was probably build in the 1950s or 60s - and looked it. Doors and closets were in hideously condition - obvious dents and peeling wood had simply been painted over. Only reason it was tolerable was the new esthetics. They played music by the pool, so any rooms near the pool heard the music from the gaps under the room doors. We had to ask to get a room change because of this. The room we finally got had gaps all the way around the room door. The air conditioner was mounted right about the door and set on 68 degrees in order to cool the room adequately - probably due to the gaps in the door! I found this ironic, as their information cards boasted "green" initative with reuse of the towels, energy efficient light bulbs, etc. The mini-fridge door rubbed on the carpet making it difficult to open, so the new carpet is not going to last long! The ice maker inside the mini-fridge was completely ice encrushed and could only be opened about 1/4 of the way. Bottom line.....we only spent one night here (had meant to spend two). Would NEVER go here again and will warn others to steer clear as well. Never did see a place that looked like the picture they have of the place on the web! Web, and person we spoke to in the office prior to going, both over-rated this place! I must admit, the front office staff was nice and responded positively to our complaints - and the fact that we checked out early.

Reviews.Title: “Creating Memories”
Reviews.Author: dreamwk00
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Super staff. Perfect location with a perfect price. The staff was very friendly and readily available to assist in any way possible. The rooms was clean with al the amendities. The ocean waves pounding the beach was music to relax and enjoy. Days Inn is the place to stay in Ocean City. There is plenty of parking also. Thanks for you hospitality Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “A great time”
Reviews.Author: huck256
Reviews.Content: My family's (7 of us) recent stay at the Days Inn was great. We had two rooms with kitchens and they were very spacious. the rooms were very clean and the housekeepers were always on hand to accomadate with any nessecities we might need. the front desk team was very hospitable. I would like to especially recognize Zack at the front desk who basically bent over backwards to help the guest. The only problem I saw," which was not really the hotels fault" happened on the evening of July 4 was persons that were not guest of the hotel, parking in the hotels lot to watch the fireworks from the boardwalk. This resulted in a shortage of parking spots for guest. Once again Zack was on hand to remedy the situation and was most apoligetic for the inconvienance. Thanks Zack ! We really enjoyed ourselves and hope to see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “5th year in a row - here is a true review”
Reviews.Author: Msasdmom
Reviews.Content: Just came back, this is our 5th year in a row here and this is everything you need to know: Location - Right on boardwalk - walk out hotel to beach; Long walk about 25 blocks to Boardwalk Amusement Rides - however very close about 5 blocks to Jolly Roger kiddie ride amusement park. Rooms: Ocean Front rooms are the best; they all have private ocean balconies and are newer decorated and clean - beds seem newer, however pull out sofa not so comfortable. Big screen tv in living room, smaller tv in bedroom area. The 4th and 5th floors are all studios / suites; huge living room and kitchen areas with separate bedrooms - they are the size of two of the rooms on floors 1 through 3. Behind the Ocean front section are two smaller Motel-like buildings surrounding the pools - some of the rooms we have seen here seem very small. The property is well taken care of with lots of flowers and trees and well maintained. There are 2 pools. One pool is in the back with the cheaper motel like rooms.... The second pool much bigger and very nice...... HOWEVER - the main pool - is run by the restaurant and the owner does not allow you to bring in food or drinks ... you must buy from the Restaurant or use the other pool if you want to eat/drink at the pool. The poolside food/drinks were actually good and sort of reasonable. Price: Very expensive for the 4th/5th floor suite/studio rooms when you reserve in advance - however I just got back and saw they had a last minute special where the same room was going for 50% off the price we just paid. The kitchen area is very nice with Refrig, Microwave, Dishwisher all china and utensils and pots/pans ... the weird part is they have no stove - but do have a small plug in electric 2 burner hot plate thing... This place has everything we actually like and so we return each year....

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING in every way!”
Reviews.Author: LisaD517
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Days Inn on 22nd st for 4 nights. From the minute we arrived to the minute we left- everything was excellent. We have a side view ocean studio room 420. The room itself was immaculate and spacious with a full kitchen and fridge. We had a double balcony and 4 adirondack chairs -the view was amazing. We arrived at the hotel at 9am and asked if we could use the pool- James at the front desk actually let us check in our room at 9am since it was ready ! PERFECT !!! we checked in and by 930am we were swimming. At one point we realized our room didnt have the mini plug in stove top so i called the front desk and told them i needed to boil my son's bottles and within literally 5 minutes someone brought one up to me. Every staff member was so friendly - even the housekeepers were great. We spilled coffee on one blanket and they left us two more. The only minor issue was on our 3rd day the kiddie pool was full of sand- so i went to the front desk and asked if someone could vaccum the sand out- and the manager Gary Johnson himself came out and hooked up the pool vac and started to do it while he waited for the pool boy to return. Excellent service in every way. The location was perfect to walk over to Fish Tales restaurant, phillips or Embers. You could even walk to Jolly Roger's. We took the tram train down to watch fireworks. I have zero complaints and will be definitely staying there again. I had my ten month old son with us and never had one concern regarding our room. They even allowed us to check out at 12pm instead of 11am. Do yourself a favor, stay here. Great pool also. But i recommend staying only in the studio rooms with the kitchen area. I saw some of the standard rooms and they were not nearly as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad...”
Reviews.Author: Amyss0127WestGrove
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel 2 days ago. I took my 12 year old daughter and her friend. We stayed in one of the oceanfront rooms on the 2nd floor. The room was nice, appeared to be clean but anyone who has stayed in a hotel knows about the carpet and comforters, right? I always wear something on my feet and I had the dirty socks to prove my point. The room was smallish but ok for the 2 nights that we stayed there. Anything longer than that and it would have been too small. We had plenty of towels and it was pretty quiet with the occasional sound of someone walking overhead. Beds were pretty comfortable. Loved the balcony!! It's on the boardwalk but away from all the craziness and there were about 6 shops two hotels over which was nice having something that close. We didn't eat at the restaurant on the premises, it's called the Anchor Restaurant but I did have some drinks by the pool (pool was nice, heated) and they were pretty good. Smoothies were a bit expensive at $5 considering I got a Mudslide which was $7. The staff at the restaurant were delightful. The hotel staff needed to be more knowledgeable about the area. Beach was excellent!!! Not crowded and plenty of lifeguards. Warning! Always lock your car. I had things stolen from my car the first night we were there. I discovered the doors unlocked the next day, which surprised me because I am a lock freak, I could have been distracted with the unloading or they could have used a tool to get in? Anyway, they didn't get much, my GPS charger, beanbag mount and my cell charger. Luckily I had my GPS with me. Still going to cost me about $80 to replace, not to mention that crappy feeling of someone violating your space. I did like that the hotel is "green" using CFL bulbs and asking you to keep balcony doors closed and re-use towels. Someone told me they were probably just trying to save $$ but it's still green so ok with me. Oh one more thing...the hotel charges $1.50 for the room safe whether you use it or not which I thought was no big deal but they do charge you $1.50 PER DAY which I thought was overkill. I probably would stay here again because the location is great and it wasn't too terribly expensive at $140 a night for June 30-July 2.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: live-your-bliss
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Days Inn with some friends for a week away. To be honest, with the $150 rate per night we were not expecting a whole lot out of the hotel. When we arrived at the office to check in, all of the staff was extremely friendly. After trying to find our room and failing- we went back to the office and they were very helpful. Once in the room we were shocked at how spacious it actually turned out to be. The room was well put together and clean. The beds were Very comfortable and we had extra pillows and blankets already in the closet which was convenient. Also, the heated pool was a god send with the ocean slightly FReezing. The only minor inconveniences were: The bathroom door rubbed the tile, which made a slightly loud noise, There was a few little ant sightings on the table, and the hot water took some time to get "hot". Over all, we all had a very enjoyable time. It was more than we expected for the cheaper rate. Also, compared to some of the hotels that our friends stayed at for the same price or more--ours was definately the on the top.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel For The Value”
Reviews.Author: R0d1
Reviews.Content: Very Much Enjoyed the 3 Nights and 4 Days Stay At Days Inn. Staff ( Maintenance, Housekeeping, Front Desk ) Extremely Friendly and Courteous. Rooms Were Clean and User Friendly , also A Nice Size With Balcony. Lovely Hotel That My Family and I Truly Enjoyed Staying At On Our Vacation In Ocean City. Would Definitely Recommend This Hotel...................

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bjlj725
Reviews.Content: I had to book a room for a bachlerette party ASAP called and booked the room the week of the stay! Price was perfect for the weekend...The beach was so busy that weekend Air Show, Ravens Parade and Car Show but they got us an amazing 2king beds with a pullout sofa clean bathroom with jet tub and a beautiful view with 2 sliding glass doors...Would 1000% stay again!

Reviews.Title: “happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: sunburywolfe
Reviews.Content: My family stayed there the first weekend in June, I was a little leary after reading some negative reviews on trip advisor. We found our ocean front room very nice, very clean & the hotel staff very very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, friendly staff, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: PSL2010
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed here and did not know what to expect, Room was great, proixmity to the beach was excellent, our stay was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Dino1959
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old son and i just returned from a weekend at the Days Inn. I was able to find an extremely reasonable price for the room-Oceanfront on the Boardwalk and wasnt sure what to expect. What i found was an older hotel that has recently tried to upgrade the rooms with new beds, a flat screen TV and (I think) new bath fixtures. The hotel is old, but overall, i was pleased with it for a weekend. Having a teenaged son, being directly on the boardwalk is definately an advantage. I dont know if i could take it for a week-the oceanfront room we had was quite small-but for 2 days, it was fine. i wanted to be on the boardwalk this time of year because once summer starts, the boardwalk can be noisey. The hotel is literally 15 ft from the actual boardwalk, and we were on the 2nd floor-so no privacy at all-if u wanted to keep the doors open. That, along with the general age of the hotel were the only real downfalls. The staff was just great...i asked for towels and coffee and within minutes they arrived. My AC did not work and again, within minutes, someone from maintenance was there to fix. The best feature is the heated pool-we were able to get in on both Friday and Saturday. The lounge chairs were comfortable and there is a pool bar on weekends. Again, I got a great deal online for this room and for the money, it worked out fine. The only thing i would not recommend is the restaurant on premises. Too expensive for "pool food".

Reviews.Title: “Might as well stay in a sewer..... Horrifying!”
Reviews.Author: heysoulsister
Reviews.Content: Things you need to stay here: Gas mask, air freshener, fresh towels, Lysol, bug spray, clean sheets, your own pillow. We walked in the lobby and felt like we were inmates in some sort of prison. Then we got our room. It smelled horrible.....HORRIBLE.! We actually had to switch to another room, which still smelled. It was the smallest room I've ever stayed in, the beds took up most of the room. Later that night I came home from the beach and wanted to take a shower. When I got out I pulled the towel from the rack and put it around me... WTF! It smelled like a goat peed on it or something. So I had to actually AIR DRY!!! >:| I warned my family about it so they had to use our sandy towels from the beach. I tried to go out on the "balcony"-which was really a brick wall- and there is no wall on the side so we could see the creepy people in the room next to us smoking, talking obnoxiously, and staring at us. All we could smell was the smoke so I had to go inside the room again which didn't really smell any better. We didn't even bother with the pool, the water would probably also smell like goats.

Reviews.Title: “Steer Clear of This Motel!”
Reviews.Author: DizNuts57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice because the group we travel with booked it, but we will never even consider returning here, or to any Days Inn for that matter. This is by far the absolute worst motel we have ever visited. The staff is completely indifferent. The first-floor rooms are horrendous. On our last trip, after checking in, we spent a half hour killing bugs and wiping cobwebs off the walls and ceiling. The mircowave, refrigerator and television were filthy, and the furniture looked as though it hadn't been dusted in months. We had to go out and buy cleanser to clean the bathtub, and even then stood on towels while showering. The bath towels had what appeared to be black tar stains all over them. Our balcony was littered with cigarette butts and trash. Unfortunately, there were not many other rooms to be had in town, so we stayed and suffered. Does anyone inspect these places? If so, I cannot imagine how this motel continues to operate!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl0313
Reviews.Content: I hate leave this type of review but I should have took the advice of previous reviews and not rented a room for the weekend at this hotel. First of all I thought I was getting a street view room, which worked out nice because is it was cruisers weekend and it would've been fun to see all the cars riding up and down the road. Well we had a first floor room which I hate anyway because everyone has to walk by your room to get to theirs, It was facing other rooms like a court yard area. That was disapointing but what was even more disopointing was the room. It had the worst smell, the floor was wet. The bathroom had mold on the walls. No exhaust fan so that is part of the problem with the mold. The room seemed like it was an after thought not really ment to be a hotel room. I wanted to complain but my fiance insisted that we just stay and not play musical rooms all weekend. I don't know if it was just our room that was totally gross or if others recently expericenced the same. I thought we might have been safe since on the website it says newly renovated rooms. Sorry Days Inn but we will not be back nor will I recomend you to my family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST DUMP IN HISTORY”
Reviews.Author: beachfan91
Reviews.Content: PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE-IT IS A ABSOLUTE DUMP. My husband and I booked his hotel and prepared for our 4 night stay. We booked a king suite, and were given a two twin bed room. The hot water heater was broken, so we could not shower. The carpet was damp. The linens were dirty, smelly and dingy. There were ants all over the bathroom. All the bathroom tiles were broken. They moved our room 3 times. The cleaning staff walked in while we had the do not disturb sign on the door. This place needs shut down- NOW. I believe homeless shelters have higher standards than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Service for an average price”
Reviews.Author: tammy_217
Reviews.Content: We arrived during a downpour, needless to say I was soaked when I got to the lobby to check in. I was offered a towel in there to dry off which was very nice of the girl. I had booked 2 rooms months ago. When we arrived they were on floors 1 and 3 which was a little disappointing.
