Also the desk clerk was not able to "explain where my room was"...We had to walk thru the rain looking for our room getting soaked all over again. The rooms were small, but honestly they were clean and no bugs/ants etc. Our complaints were the toilet ran every 5 minutes (which was reported and not fixed), and the 2nd night when we went to shower there was no hot water at all, we called to the room on 3rd floor thinking we could go there to shower, it also had no hot water. Checked again at about 6am, 7am and finally around 930 there was hot water. We were told "something broke and had to wait for the part".... When your covered in sand and need a shower, that was not a great experience. The good things about this hotel was the location, the price, and the HEATED pool. I would stay there again (I think, if the price was right). ---- They charge you $1.50 a day to use the hotel safe..when you check out you had to tell them that you did not use it for them to credit your account.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: AzoresPrincess
Reviews.Content: The Days Inn should be shut down....if enough complaints are made maybe it will happen. We figured its a Days Inn how bad can it be....well it couldn't get any worse. Arrived on August 26, 2009 and on that evening moved 4x due to Air conditioning problems, leaking ceilings, wall airconditioning units leaking water onto bed, holes in the wall in the bathroom, and then finally we had to move one additonal time because the room was infested with ants crawling on the beds, nightstands, Kitchen countertop and now upon reading the reviews there seems to be bed bugs....OMG....I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. As we switched rooms each time the housekeeping was worse, food was left in refrig from prior guests.....who know if the sheets were even changed.....JUST HORRIBLE. The service is horrible the manageR Gary can never be reached we left on August 28th and were told he was dealing with issues at another hotel he manages WOW what a surprise. We requested a call from him and left cell number it is now Sept. 1st. and we are still waiting for a return call. We were vacationing with three children and would never want them to experience this again.......Just Horrible...no matter what price they are offering I would not stay there again ever. Dirty, bugs, you name it.

Reviews.Title: “They don't care how they get YOUR money-”
Reviews.Author: PMSheidi
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Days Inn since 2000 and it has been declining every year. The ants, lack of supplies and bedding were always overlooked- not a major issue, just an inconvenience. It was reasonabley priced that allowed us to be a group and enjoy. We know we did not book the Ritz Carlton.The location is perfect for our large group of 25-30 families(every year). The initial report of bed begs- the room immediately next to ours was the first one - and there was no way to miss them. Our neighbors were treated without respect let alone dignity. 2 days later, many of our rooms had confirmation of the bed bugs. My husband collected a few- no one was interested in 'seeing' them let alone seeing the bites on my daughter or another's child. We were moved to another tiny room and we were expected to be so happy about it. The manager, Gary, who seemed to be concerned, was unable to do anything to help us. And on day of check out, he was expected to be at the motel at 9am, he didn't show up until after 10a- I am guessing he was hoping we would not want to wait and he wouldn't have to deal with us. The corporation for Days Inn sent us a letter weeks later, letting us know there is nothing they can do because this is a privately owned francise. Obviously, we will not be customers with Days Inn anywhere, let alone any hotels/motels under this Boardwalk Corporation(there are several others under the same owner and management). STAY AWAY- they will take your money regardless of you! They need to recuperate the money for the money it will costing them for the extermination of the bed bugs as well as the cost for new beds and linens.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, housekeeping not so great”
Reviews.Author: kafranz
Reviews.Content: My husband, myselp and my 3 children spent a week at the Days Inn in early August and had a great time. We had an Oceanview Studio with a great view of the beach and the staff we're very nice in our dealings with them. The pools are great and when we were not on the beach we loved hanging out in the pool area. My only complaints are with regard to houskeeping which has seriously deteriorated over the years. Although the kitchen and bathroom areas were clean (other than a few ants) there was a heavy build up of dust around the perimeter of the room and on the air conditioner. There was also alot of sand build up between the patio doors and where the curtains meet the wall that could be easily vacuumed My opinion is the housekeeping staff is either too few or just plain lazy doing as little as possible. I also think it's time to replace the couch and chairs in the room which are really showing their age (aside from average wear and tear alot of staining). Although I hate to say it because we've always loved staying at the Days Inn I probably will not stay there again just do to overall room cleanliness, Hopefully the Days Inn will take a look at the reviews and make the necessary improvements because it really is a prime location and holds many good memories for my family.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS A DUMP AND DOUBLE CHECK YOU CREDIT CARD BILL”
Reviews.Author: jeannelynnc
Reviews.Content: The room was dirty, microwave rusty inside, no screen door on slider, the room smelled aweful. Staff, other than Janet, not friendly nor helpful. Price charged not what I was quoted. DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Nasty, rooms are tiny, rates are rediculous!”
Reviews.Author: nbateman
Reviews.Content: My b/f and I normally stay at the Grand next door, but they had overbooked and offered to put us up for the night at the Days Inn and reimburse for the room if there was a price difference. They also offered us a free night during the rest of our stay, so we said ok. The Days Inn had the same rate as the Grand so we thought that we'd be in the same size room with the same conditions. Ha!!!! The room was soo small and so was the bathroom. The only place we had to store our toiletries was on the microwave cart because there were no countertops (besides the toilet). We were booked at a ground level room oceanfront with a step out porch. The porch was akward since everyone walking by on the boardwalk was looking at us. The room was kept cool with a window unit air conditioner that was above the door. This was the best part since it did keep us cool for the day that we stayed there. The shower ceiling was moldy and there was some funk on the bottom of the shower that I didn't go near. I don't know where the picture of the marble shower was from on expedia's site b/c we stayed at the best room and there was no marble to be seen lol!!! There was funk on the floor and behind the toilet. There was a window in the bathroom that when opened would look out to the people going to the elevator. It was frosted but I believe that if you were naked in the bathroom people would be able to see you. Thank goodness we only stayed for one night and were headed back next door to the Grand where the rooms are all oceanfront and clean!!!!! Never again, what a disapointment!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Inn”
Reviews.Author: ayngirl
Reviews.Content: If you want to bring home PETS stay at the Bed Bug Inn. We have been staying there for nine years and overlooked many things including ants. The location is great but the hospitality is horrendous. If you want the staff to lie to you stay at the Bed Bug Inn. Our new name for the Days Inn. Our stay started off great until day four of our vacation when one of our party checked in late that night and disovered the little pests crawling all over the walls, in the frame of a picture and on the beds. When they reported this to the front desk they were handed a can of Raid. Needless to say they stayed in their car all night. They were not issued a room until the following afternoon. The next day Bed Bugs were found in more rooms. After repeated requests to have an exterminator check all the rooms they finally agreed on day 6. On that day the exterminator found bed bug eggs in one room and all the remaining rooms had signs of bed bugs (fecal, and bed bug casings).

Reviews.Title: “Do not take your family here !!!”
Reviews.Author: RocklandBeachBum
Reviews.Content: My family I have been staying here for a couple of years. (over 25 room each summer)We knew there were some housekeeping issues but this last trip was the WORST. Rooms INFESTED with ants and bedbuds. There was mold, dirt, dirty sheets, I had to go a get the maid and tell to to vaccum 2 and 3 times after I saw she didn't. The property is going down hill and the lack of maintance shows. We had multiple families that had to be move to other rooms, 1 family sat outside at 3am because the desk clerk said he didn't have any rooms available for him ( his room had large amount of bed bugs) Extermintor final came to 1 room and found eggs in the couch sprayed, then said your OK now?? The Manager Gary called his superiors to get some people moved to the large suites was told NO! and this is a family run business! It is obivios the owner wants all the cash in his pocket. There was also credit charging problems with some...EVERYTHING STATED IN PREVIOUS BAD REVIEWS IT TRUE>>>>Save your familys vacation spend a litlle extra stay somewhere else..this hotel also had 2 people die in 2006 due to Carbon Monoxide leak ..no detectors! ( google the article) Some staff members HORIBLE others are very nice people I feel bad they have to work in this condition.

Reviews.Title: “Poor housekeeping, nice location,”
Reviews.Author: funlovinginNewYork
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the two other families we traveled with had the same problems as we did. The oceanfront studio was a nice large room and I believe the only room in the hotel with queen beds vs double beds. It had a beautiful ocean view and very large balcony. That being said the hotel was a big dissapointment because of issues we had with housekeeping. We had a kitchen which could not be used because anytime we had food on the counter the ants came and joined us. Other than picking up our towels I don't think the bathrooms were ever cleaned. They did leave plenty of towels but never left extra soap or toilet paper. Empty shampoo bottles and slivers of soap were always left in the tub. I asked the maid to go back and please clean the toilet and she looked at me like i was bothering her. There was sand on the floor, I don't think they ever vacumned. I will say management was polite and tried to make us happy. We changed rooms the second day but that room had ants as well. They then discounted our room for us since we could not use the kitchen which was one of the reasons we had chosen that particular room , which I believe is their most expensive room. Had we not had problems with housekeeping I would recommend this hotel. As I said the location is great and management did the best they could to make us happy. Unfortunatly we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “I Too was Scammed, Don't let this happen to You!”
Reviews.Author: CWBCW
Reviews.Content: Upon check-out after a 2 nights stay on 7/26 my credit card was declined, so I paid with another card, however when I got home and checked my account online I found not only had my card been processed for the amount ($337.87) but also for $1889.22 . My initial deposit was also paid with the same card upon reservation on 7/17 for $314.87. There were many more attempts for vayring amounts including $ 2217.09 on 7/24, $500.00 on 7/25, $317.87 once on 7/25 and twice on 7/26, $629.74 on 7/24, and $314.87 twice on 7/24. I was told by the manager (Gary Johnson) on 7/28 that my card was billed in error and that my card would be refunded. I have yet to be refunded and this is many attempts at fraud (probably collecting cash from patrons and billing my card for their stay. This matter is now in the hands of the fraud investigative unit of the credit card issuer. I have also contacted the Office of Comptroller of Maryland to look into this matter.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the thought”
Reviews.Author: brooklynnguess29
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed there from July 24-27 2009 and it was better than the bad reviews suggested. We had an oceanfront view room with a large balcony, the view of the sun rising over the ocean in the morning was breathtaking. The room was small but it was only the two of us so it was fine. The best part was that the hotel was right on the boardwalk, so you walk out of the hotel right onto the boardwalk and onto the beach. LOVED IT! They have two swimming pools which was great for us because the main pool in the middle was always crowded and we don't like crowds but the pool in the back by the bar was just right, it had an older crowd of people. The only complaint I have is that the bathroom could have been a little cleaner there was some dirt and grime around the faucet that I had to clean off with the clorox wipes that Im glad I brought with me, and the bathtub had a slow drain which was gross to stand in but again I sprayed the tub with lysol before I showered just as a precaution. The smell of mildew was not overwhelming but it was expected because when you come from the beach or the pool with wet items and put them on the carpet it happens. Overall I thought the location was great away from all the noise and crowd, right on the boardwalk and the oceanfront second floor room that I was in had a great view. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I will be back next year and I will definitely stay in the Days Inn. UNLESS I CAN FIND A BETTER DEAL. LOL......OH P.S. HAD A GOOD BREAKFAST AT THE RESTARAUNT TOO.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: westmomPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: My 22 year old son, his friend and I recently spent 4 nights at the Days Inn. It was only after making the reservation that I saw the awful reviews. I am an experienced traveler and began to think I had made a huge mistake. Despite all the doom and gloom, we had a great time. No major problems, no smell of mildew, no mold and we couldn't find a bug inside or out during our whole time there. And I have to say that we had the most comfortable beds I may ever have slept in at a hotel. The pools were clean, the landscaping beautiful and the location was great. We stayed in the rooms surrounding the smaller of the two pools. If you're looking for a place to stay that caters to the twenty to thirty somethings, I would have no problem recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I've ever stayed at. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: TabbyCat9989
Reviews.Content: My family was staying at the Grand and we booked the Days Inn because we wanted to stay one last night in OC and our original hotel didn't have vacancy. What a mistake. Upon arriving we discovered the hotel looked like a prison. When we got inside, the room was very ugly. It reeked so badly of mildew that we had to go to the front desk to switch the room. When we got to the other room, it smelled of cleaning products. The room was so small that you had to jump on the bed to let other people walk by, and all of us are normal/thin sized people. We stayed out of the room as much as possible and when we came back to get a shower we had to use our beach towels because the towels smelled like they hadn't been washed since the hotel was founded. No one bothered to use the soap that was provided. When we went to bed, my mom opened the bathroom door with the light on to ward the bugs away. The air conditioner was very loud through out the night. Also, the deck was very crumby and ugly with only 2 plastic chairs. DONT STAY THERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Bug spray and mildew! You'll want to check out as soon as you check in.”
Reviews.Author: travelepeople
Reviews.Content: When I opened the door to the room I was wafted in the face with an overpowering smell of mildew. The bathroom was remodeld, however, the can of Raid they must of sprayed was sickening. The towels smelled horrible and I decided to just use the sandy ones we had from the beach instead. Rooms are really cramped. I felt like I was in a cave out on the balcony. I agree....better off sleeping on the beach!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to all the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Readinger
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and before we left I looked up reviews for this hotel. I thought OMG this place sounds like a dump! But it was fine the room was clean and we saw no bugs or mold. I think no matter where some people stay they will always find something wrong. They only thing I didn't like was how far up the boardwalk we were.

Reviews.Title: “not what we were expecting”
Reviews.Author: lyss09
Reviews.Content: First of all we get there and we got to check in early which was nice, then the people at the front desk told us to move our car closer after giving us a parking pass. We tried but there was no parking. Then our room was not what we expected. There was no pull out couch the room was smaller and the beds were fulls not queens. We went to talk to the front desk and they gave us the wrong room and gave us $30 off. The people at the front desk lied and said we had queen beds when we really didnt.... Then we came back and realized our room was dirty and we did not like being on the ground floor on the boardwalk so we called up the Holiday Inn and booked it and left the days inn and got a refund. The Holiday Inn was amazing and we got a suite for the same price we paid for a regular size room at the Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: Swiftli
Reviews.Content: Website makes the room look so much bigger. We had deluxe effec room. The divider that was to seperate the room was removed. Room had two TVs...one was broke. Tile floor in kitchenette & bathroom felt slimy greasy in bafefeet. Yuck! Bathtub looked nasty, I wasn't about to give my 4&5 yr olds baths in it. I made them take showers. ANTS ARRIVED ON OUR LAST DAY IN FORCE.....Luckily we were leaving. Seems during our family vacation a motorcycle club had rented the majority of the hotel and spent days and evenings mobbing the parking lot with loud bikes and music. Not what I planned for my young family to experience OC for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay here unless you can get an ocean front room w/ balcony”
Reviews.Author: Gemini27
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff lies.....I was traveling with my physically challenged daughter, elderly mother, a sister who had recently suffered from a stroke and a 5 year old. When I made the reservations directly with the hotel I emphasised that I needed handicapped accessable rooms. When we arrived they expected me to take a wheelchair down 2 stairs. The hotel was not clean, it needs some work, we got locked out of the room one night because the lock was broken so they came and showed us how to wiggle the key so you could get in the door. they had to move us and the ONLY decent thing was that the new room had a beautiful view of the ocean....

Reviews.Title: “This place sucks!!! Dont stay here....Run elsewhere....”
Reviews.Author: AbercrombieKid
Reviews.Content: This place refused to give what reservations quoted for package deal. We were to have oceanfront room & ended up with poolside w/no elevator to carry luggage up 3 flights of stairs-Charged higher room price, refused to give allotted food vouchers & tram tickets promised with package-This place is literally a rip-off-The rooms and drawers smell of mold/mildew. We couldn’t even use the drawers to put our clothes in they stunk so badly. Mold spores growing in bathroom window. No fan in bathroom. Mirrors stayed wet for hours after showers. The carpet needs replaced everywhere-Our key cards had to be replaced daily as our door was faulty which was a BIG inconvenience-The room stunk & now that we are home our clothes smell just like the room did-Take your money & run elsewhere~Its not worth ruining your vacation to deal with these jerks!!!!They make the offer sound good over the phone then when you get there, they say this isn’t what you were offered & want to charge you more. Virtual tour makes the place look good-trust me, it looks nothing like this!!!! The pools & rooms are tiny!!! Housekeeping staff was very friendly but they could not help us with our issues. Carpet is dirty, worn & stained. balconies are in severe need of repair. Walls & floors/ceilings very thin-you can hear everything below & above you-very noisy at all times-The poolside balcony doors are swelled from dampness & the only way to shut them is to bang them so that is what you hear all night long. Rooms are so small that beds are tight against the wall & every time you move at night you hit the jagged spackled wall & the plastic blinds that hang by the windows and makes such a racket it wakes everyone in the room. Blinds are broken & you can’t put them up so you don’t bump them while sleeping- We complained & they wouldn’t do anything about any of it. Then they charge you for calling the front front desk to get your key card recoded. The worst hotel experience ever-save yourself a hassle and stay anywhere else-This was our first & LAST stay at this hole! The "so-called" role-playing mgr Dan Willis in reservations is very rude and should learn some manners. Never had to encounter such an incompetent group of folks & hope I never have to again~I know I wont at the Days Inn! We were woken at 3:45 for a false fire alarm for over an hour during a thunderstorm also on our 1st night there. STAY NEXT DOOR AT THE GRAND-IT IS BEAUTIFUL & CLEAN & THE ROOMS DO NOT SMELL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Compromise”
Reviews.Author: Dad-With-Two-Kids
Reviews.Content: My family of four has these requirements for Ocean City: 1. A place on or near the Boardwalk to avoid our young sons crossing busy streets to get to the beach; 2. A suite with a kitchenette; 3. A queen or king bed for my wife and I; 4. A pool for the kids (even next to the beach. In the past, we stayed at the Dunes Manor (very expensive but very nice), and the Quality Inn at 17th Street (less expensive but acceptable- see my prior review). This summer, we tried to book late and could not get what we wanted from either of the above properties, so we tried the Days Inn instead. It was between the other two properties geographically, and in terms of cost and amenities. The Days Inn has apparently been updated recently, and the Ocean View Suite was excellent. it is only one big room but the furniture is arranged to create some privacy between the bedroom side (queen bed) and the living room side (convertible sofa). Each side has a television. The kitchennette has a full refigerator, dish washer, sink, toaster, micro and a hotplate. The bathroom looks like new and the room was very clean. The Days Inn has two pools with a pool side bar in between that serves bar food as well as drinks. There is a restaruant that we tried for breakfast and it was okay but there are better values elsewhere on the island. The location is 23rd Street. This is not quite as convenient as the Quality Inn on 17th Street but it is next to the only row of Boardwalk shops north of 18th Street so it is easy to get pizza, ice cream, and souvenirs. Inland from the Boardwalk, Phillips Crab House, a Wine shop, Candy Kitchen, and mini-golf are within a couple blocks. The staff were friendly and helpful. All-in-all, it exceeded our expectations. It was certainly the most expensive Day Inn that we have ever come across but better than the chain typically offers. We consider it a real option for our annual Ocean City stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on You”
Reviews.Author: romeomom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay at the Days Inn Ocean City Maryland. The motel was pricy and very, very dirty. The Sheets were strained . Each Night I had to shake out the sheets to get rid of the fleas that decided to take refuse on my bed. I had to sleep on the top sheet and the blanket. At one point, they decided not to clean the room but left clean towels in a bag on a door. At $285.00 a night, I expected more. I will never stay in this joint again. I was so happy that I had the foresight to bring lysol with me to spray the tub because I do not like taking a shower with their guests.

Reviews.Title: “The Ants go marching one by one!”
Reviews.Author: BugsPa
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel on Sunday, August 17 for a four night vacation. The check in staff was very rude and inconsiderate, as we were left standing outside of the hotel for 45 minutes waiting for our room cards and help with our luggage. The help never arrived....we struggled with luggage all the way up to the fourth floor...as the elevators were not working! The rooms were in need of an updating and a good cleaning. The kitchen area was infested with ants.....lots and lots of ants. I complained to the front desk service personnel, only to be told "the hotel does have ants...but only certain times of the year." Well I have never stayed in a hotel with ants! We could not use the kitchen area..with the little bugs crawling over everything. We purchased snacks for the beach....which I had to discard because of the ant problem. The vending machine was out of bottled water for days. We had to beg for clean towels and wash clothes. The front desk personnel should all be fired for their rude attitudes! I asked for directions and help with finding a restaurant that I had read about...only to be told...look it up in the books located in the lobby. Senior Management should really take a good look at the employees and the extreme lack of any good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: pmmmm
Reviews.Content: I paid over $300.00 a night for an overpriced room that smelled like mildew, the bathroom was filthy and I had spider bites on my body from sleeping in the beds. The stairwells were littered with cigarettes and trash. My room telephone did not work for two days and at checkout I was charged for a room safe I did not use. What an awful experience. I will never return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: ratherrome
Reviews.Content: This hotel use to be the Surf and Sands. A very nice and well priced hotel while I was bringing up the kids. Now that the kids are about to have their own kids, I will not recommend this hotel. On a recent stay, My wife and I could not relaxe due to the roudiness of the guests in adjacent rooms and security knocking at the door at midnight. The hotel may not be able to control who they book but they should be able to suply a family atmosphere where the thought of making a complaint other than "house maintainance" complaints should not exist. As for the rooms, they are what I remember. Small with small beds.( they were fine when the kids were small) I would recommend mangement should limit the room to two adults or two adults with 2 children if there are kids. Or, trade the two small beds in for a double or queen size that would attract couples.The shower head was broke and the refridgerator would not get cold. ( minor) The $278.95 per night charged for this room was in no way worth the value. Unfortunatly, gratuitities could not be left because I was not going to pay another dime.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: jessmat
Reviews.Content: I expected the worst after reading the reviews but I was pleasantly surprised by my experience at the hotel. The staff was very nice. The rooms were clean and so was the pool area. There was some minor wear and tear on the hotel but nothing that significant. We stayed in an oceanfront room on the first floor so I can't speak of any of the other rooms. My only complaint would be the beds. They say that they are doubles but they seem quite small. Other than that, our experience was good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ttoothfary
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in oc many times and this was the worst place we have ever stayed at! Nothing like the website makes it seem. Old and dirty! Smelled like a combination of wet dog, smoke, and urine! Old, dry and crusty food left on curtains and on nightstand. Bathroom was gross! did not even dare to go near the pool. We could not wait to get out of there!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful tropical garden of Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: ooouch
Reviews.Content: Nicely re-done 5th floor suites. New baths with a nice jacuzzi tub. Nice touch with second vanity; however, i would add a matching shelf near it . The balcony railings need to be resurface & the chairs on the balcony need to be replaced, they had rust spots all over them. The beds were comfy. The tv's need to be updated (our remote control was missing it's battery cover). Also need dvd players. The kitch table should be updated too. Perhaps a pretty beachy design as opposed to the old wood look. The kitch chairs were very dirty. There was a good layer of dust that needs to be scrubbed off, not just feather dusted. Also the sides of the pretty vanity (on the floor) were probably not cleaned since the vanity was installed. I know this because my daughter's toothbrush fell down there and she got so grossed out we bought her a new one. Fairly well-stocked kitchen. It was nice to have dish liquid, wash rags, d/w detergent. We did however need a can opener which the front desk could not locate, the house keeper (kala) did, and may I add, very quickly. She was a very accommodating employee. The top of the fridge needs a good wipe. The pool area is lovely. The bar tender kim was real kool and really made our family comfy. There was a large amount of cigaret butts on the parking lot that grossed us out. The elevators were nicely re-tiled; however, there was a very unpleasant smell in one of them. There needs to be a better located rinse off shower when returning from the beach. Perhaps one thats before you enter the pool area..The one in the pool corner is inconvenient to all. Also the shower rooms need to be checked more often for T.P and cleanliness. There was a discusting backup. All in all the staff was pleasant and helpful aside from a few of the maids who seemed inconvenienced . Really enjoyed the grassy front with the gazebos, a very nice touch. The Days Inn on 23rd & boardwalk is in a great location with many shops and activities right at your fingertips. With a few inexpensive changes this hotel could be right up there with the "big wigs". We stayed in room s521 and will return and hopefully see these changes.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: bagebe
Reviews.Content: I have never had a more horrible stay in a hotel room in my life, and for the cost of the room this really upsets me. Lets first start with the room. It was very, very small, and the bathroom was pitiful and dirty. There door to the room had a huge gap around the opening, and the window in the bathroom hardly shut all the way. There were no shelves in the bathroom, which caused me to place my items on the sink, and clothes on the toilet lid. The screen to the balcony door was ripped off the frame of the door. I called the front desk where I was told they had no more screens and the only room they could move me to was the first floor. Now since I paid for a balcony room I told them I would not take the first floor, and the front desk clerk said she would send maintenance up. When he got to the room he looked at the screen and then asked me if I even needed a screen for the door, which really upset me. I am paying $149.99 a night for a room, I would like the option to open the balcony glass door and close the screen so that I can get a breeze in the very small room. After about an hour they installed a new screen which was taken from another room, and still didn't put it on the track right so I had to fight with it every time I wanted to go out on the balcony. Also the balcony was supposed to have dividers between the rooms, mine did not, in fact the whole third floor did not, which also upset me, but since they could only move me to the first floor I had to deal with it. When I took the virtual tour it showed the dividers. I was not expecting a 5 star hotel, however for the price I was paying a night I feel really ripped off. Now lets talk about the staff, I find it incredibly rude for the house keeping staff to sit out on the customers balconies and smoke while they are supposed to be working. Everyday, and I mean everyday that I stayed there, the staff was smoking on someone's balcony. Stay at another hotel if you can, do not stay at this one!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel On The Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: youwish19
Reviews.Content: I want to start off by saying this hotel is among the best of the best to pick from when staying in Ocean City! We stayed at this Days Inn because another hotel we reserved through had overbooked the rooms, Days Inn was so nice and cooperative. The front desk staff were some of the nicest I have ever had. The best part about this hotel is the beautiful rooms. These rooms are way nicer than most on the boardwalk. We stayed in an oceanfront room with a balcony on the very top floor and it cost about $119.00 a night... WOW, That is the best price you can get!!! Granted it was off season, but a lot of other hotels still try to charge full price, Not Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “I have not even made it to Days Inn - BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: AngelAware
Reviews.Content: I have yet to arrive at the Days Inn Oceanfront in Ocean City ,MD. and I will never make it. I made reservations about two months ago and paid the "deposit" with a credit card. Everything was good. About three weeks later - Days Inn debited, credited, debited, credited my account and all I got was there is "clitch" in the system and that all is okay, nothing other than the original deposit has been applied and deducted from my card. I accepted that because it was confirmed by my credit company that the problem had been corrected. Now, its about three weeks later and the same problem is occurring again but this time the amount deducted has doubled from the original deposit, now Days Inn has paid itself twice as much money for the whole stay. When I add the original deposit plus the current deduction from card, Days Inn has literally paid itself double the amount. Never in my life would I give Days Inn of all establishements close to $900.00 for a three night stay. I have been trying to get in touch with the "General Manager, who I have been told did receive my urgent message and now its hours later and no reply. The customer service at this establishment stinks!!! I would think it proper to contact potential guests via mail or phone and inform them that there is problem with the "system" and that all is okay, but not from this place. I was even told by a front desk clerk that I had to get proof of this deduction and I had to send it to them. Even though she sees the money applied to the reservation and tells me that there has been a problem with the "system", yet she does not believe it is Days Inn's responsibility to correct their mistake. All in all this experience has totally soured my opinion of Days Inn and I will never even contemplate about staying in one and I will inform everyone to BEWARE of this chain.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok..”
Reviews.Author: tgalaxy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during off-season 5/08. I liked the location as its directly on the beach. I liked the space of the room. However, the water tasted funky and there was a huge weird dark stain in the middle of the room. Other than that it was ok. They will try to charge you for the safe by including it as mandatory part of your bill and insist that you can only remove it only upon checking out. Also, the concierge tried to double charge me when I checked out even though my room was pre-booked and pre-paid. After speaking with the manager they fixed the "error" and the lady was like "oops sorry about that." I didn't like that and probably won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Experience”
Reviews.Author: holiday17
Reviews.Content: The Days Inn Boardwalk is newly renovated and has a great location on the Boards at 23rd Street. My family booked 2 Oceanfront Studio Suites. Upon check in, the front desk agent said that we could not check into our studio suites for our reservation had a payment error, which in the end, it was the desk's fault to begin with. After travelling 6 hours, we wanted smooth sailing but it took a turn down a confusing complicated path. Nonetheless, we checked in. The one suite was spectacular, but however, the other one has some defects such as a soaked carpeting the whole entire stay there. We used over 3 dozen of towels to soak up the water out of the rug. Nonetheless, we loved the expansive balcony, new room smell, and gorgeous beachfront views. At check out, they graciously gave us a whole nite's room and tax off and sent us a check in the mail 5 months later. Besides the confusion at check in and the soaked carpeting for 3 nites, 4 days...it wasn't all that bad, but being an Ocean City, MD hotel buff, I told the people I was going with my opinion about here...Stay somewhere else. Try the Flamingo Motel, Quality Inn Boardwalk, or Spinnaker Motel were my suggestions but went along with them on the Days Inn and my hunch was right.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Decent Experience”
Reviews.Author: lottafun
Reviews.Content: I waited until the last minute to book a week at the beach---in August! The Days Inn had a room at an extemely reasonable rate--$184+taxes. I decided to take it. I went to Trip Advisor and checked out the reviews. I was worried that I made a mistake. From the reviews, the place sounded like a dump. We arrived and checked in in a timely manner. When I opened the door to our room, I braced myself but to my surprise it was nice. It was what I would expect from a Days Inn. The carpet was clean. The room was clean. We had a poolside room. It was pleasant. I did see a few ants in the bathroom but it was only one or two. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mln27
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online and am sorry I did. We got there around 2 p.m. The oceanfront room wasn't ready yet but no problem because check-in is 3. By 3:30 it still wasn't ready and while we were in the lobby waiting we heard maid staff complaining about their jobs and the manager telling an employee over the phone to "get off his c-ck." I thought, OK, maybe I misheard what he said and figured let's just see how the room is. We finally get our room key and were completely disappointed with what we saw. The Web site doesn't tell you that rooms on certain floors don't have private balconies with walls going all the way up. So you're basically out on the balcony and can see all the other people on their balconies who happen to be staying on the same floor. There's only a little wall, maybe 2 feet high, separating the balconies. The room also is tiny and cramped, and the beds are very bouncy. There are two outdoor pools, but they're tiny. There's an on-site eatery that didn't look like a place where I'd ever eat. We disliked the room so much--particularly for the price we paid--that we just had to get out of there and find someplace else to stay. Luckily, the manager let us leave without charging us (I hope--haven't received the credit card bill yet) for the room deposit or for a night's stay (which I would have fought considering we were in the room less than half an hour). We ended up staying at the Quality Inn Oceanfront at 5400 Coastal Highway and were happy there. It was a little cheaper and a lot nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: lrc2luvsmjc1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Delmarva Bike week and have to say that I was very disappointed in our stay at the Days Inn. We requested a king size bed, but with that luxury, received a crappy road side room right next to/above the bar. It was very loud (which we expect anyway during bike week) but when I went to the office to request a different room, I got serious attitude. Another problem which was shrugged off our entire stay was the fact that we had NO HOT WATER. It would get hot in the shower for 3 minutes and then go cold. What a lovely stay?! NOT. We will not return to the Days Inn next year for Bike Week.

Reviews.Title: “OK, could of been worse!”
Reviews.Author: jab14
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an extended weekend stay at the Days Inn Oceanfront, Ocean City, MD. We stayed in an oceanfront suite.. thank goodness the views were great, because the room was not so hot. The pull out sofa bed had a huge dip in the middle and our sons ended up sleeping on the edge of the mattress. We asked for a diiferent room, but was told they were booked solid, though the suite next door to ours was empty for 3/4 of our stay. There were unfinished repairs to a ceiling light in the corner of the kitchen, leaving on less light in an already dark room. The water pressure for the shower was awful. There should of been a schedule for when people were to shower. I attempted to take a shower one afternoon and there was absolutely no water coming from the shower, due to the pressure being so low. The housekeeping to the room became worse each day we were there. Each day, we had to ask to have the beds made and floor swept and vacumned. My husband would end up getting trash bags from the front desk, since the only trash can that was consistantly emptied was the one in the kitchen. This is a wounderful location..directly on the boardwalk and oceanfront, but there were no outdoor showers to spray off chairs and feet before returning to the rooms. This resulted in more sand that housekeeping did not clean up. There was a small buffet type place to eat at the hotel, but the food was not very good and the price was as bloated as the price of the room was. We will not stay at this hotel chain again, I feel I was taken advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: hlfch5
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I had no idea what to expect. When we got there, we had to wait to check in....but they allowed to use the changing room to go to the pool. Carpets were stained and dirty...ants in the bathroom. Doors didn't seal tight and the sliding door didn't move until we got after it with some WD40. We were promised 4 adjoining rooms in a row....we had a large group but when we got there, that was not available. As in other reviews, the sheets aren't changed due to water conservation but you can get clean towels daily. There is no guest laundry which would have been nice since we were on the beach. It was easily accessible to the beach and we could walk across the street for milk and bread. It wasn't the worst place that I ever stayed but it wasn't the best either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: starbrite1805
Reviews.Content: Despite all the bad reviews written about this hotel, we were able to get a good deal through travelocity, so we decided to give it a shot, and we had an excellent time. The original room that we had booked had been overbooked or something, so they gave us one of their best rooms. Everything was clean and beautiful. The people at the desk were very friendly & were not at all irritated when I came back down to ask a few questions. The only downside was that most parking was across the street. However, we were in walking distance of everything we wanted to do so this was no problem. We also had trouble ordering delivery from their pizza place. Much of the staff there couldn't speak much english and our order got messed up. The pool was nice, very warm for the beginning of july! Overall we were impressed :)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Anthony471
Reviews.Content: This was horrible. We stayed in an Oceanfront room & it was just a disaster. First off, I LOVED how the first floor rooms are set up. The balcony is amazing. All you have to do is step over the wall & you are on the Boardwalk! I LOVED the first floor room. The hotel staff is TERRIBLE! The manager is an idiot & is very rude. DO NOT TRY TO CHECK IN EARLY!! Check in AFTER the time they tell you. Don't try to go in early. That was the mistake that we made. Uh, the pizza place was excellent. Good food. The pools are okay. The hotel needs rennovated. All the hotels down there suck, but this one is pretty old. NO ELEVATOR! VERY OLD. I would NOT reccommend you to stay here. Find somewhere cheaper. It was so expensive for us & it sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Trishmae
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms at this hotel - a Studio Oceanfront Room for my husband and myself and a standard Oceanfront Room for my son and his girlfriend. The Studio Oceanfront Room was really beautiful and comfortable - just like the website. The standard Oceanfront room with two double beds was clean, but was smaller than your average hotel room, and was a little dated. The one thing I thought was strange was that the studio had a full size refrigerator and dishwasher, but had no stove. There was a two-burner hot plate in one of the cupboards. It wasn't a problem for me, but if you want to cook for a family, this could be a drawback. The Jacuzzi did not work. The hotel informed us that they don't advertise the Jacuzzi anymore, since there are so many maintenance problems with them. They offered to move us, but we didn't want to go through the trouble since we were only there for three days. They did, however, take 10% off our bill because of this. The view from the oceanfront balcony is absolutely gorgeous. The balconies on the 4th and 5th floors are large and very nice. The restaurant on-site had a marvelous all you can eat breakfast buffet. The grounds were nice. The staff was friendly. The maids didn't seem to knock themselves out cleaning, though. They gave you fresh towels and soap, cleaned the bathroom, and made your beds and that was about it. They didn't even vaccum daily. I was a little nervous about staying at this hotel because of all the bad reviews. It wasn't that bad. The major issue was the noise from the patrons. There was a college fraternity group staying there over the weekend and they were quite noisy. After they left on Sunday, things quieted down quite a bit. If you want a quiet, relaxing vacation - I don't think this is the place for you. I get the feeling that this is a popular hotel for college kids and party people. I'm sure it can be quite noisy in the summertime since it's right on the boardwalk. If you want quiet, I would suggest an off the boardwalk hotel, or only stay at this hotel through the week, off-season. If you like to party, go ahead and book your room now!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Price for the family suite was good--that's about the best thing I can say about this hotel. We stayed for four nights and service was almost non-existent. We called the front desk for clean towels and finally someone from Housekeeping came with towels and a surly attitude about 4:00PM. She pulled up the covers on the beds, dropped off towels, took trash, cleaned nothing, and left. The next day--same thing, including surly attitude. There was a plumbing problem we reported at 9:00AM. Maintenance finally arrived after 3:30PM. TV in the master bedroom didn't work. Three bedrooms, one alarm clock. Third day, housekeeping dropped off clean towels inside the door and did nothing else. Hotel is close to the beach which was nice, but lack of amenities and service put a real damper on our vacation. I won't stay at a Days Inn anywhere again! Manager adjusted our bill at check-out but that didn't make up for the inconveneince, rudeness of the staff, or lack of service.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was bad from the minute I tried to check in. The confused and incompetent desk staff took a very long time to check us in and was less than helpful as far as recommending where to park. Then, try to find your room. Well, if you are put in S157, would you not expect it to be at the same end of the building as S155? I did. When it wasn't, I trudges all teh way back to the front desk, lugging all of my stuff to ask where my room was. The man at the desk looked at me like I had 3 heads when I asked this, and did not understand why it dodn't make sense to me that the room was over by S103, tucked in a dingy corridor near the supply closet. Forget about a property map, that isn't going to happen. Oh- and there is one ice machine, go up to 3 to get to it. When I walked into the dingy, horrible, smelly room, I was appalled. I don't believe they sell lower wattage bulbs than what they were using in there and the AC was totally off, no fan or anything blowing. When I went ot unload my cooler into the refrigerator, I found it to be unplugged and covered with mold spots everywhere. Not to mention that it smelled like feet. I had no cleaning products with me, I do not travel with them as I should not have to when paying exhorbitant hotel rates. The carpet was dirty and stained and the bathroom was bad as well. The water pressure was practically non-existent and you could not get a comfortable water temperature. When the front desk was asked for more towels, I was very rudely informed that there was no one to bring them to me, I would have to go get them. All in all, this hotel made my first visit to Ocean City very unappealing.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: meg1621
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I was extremely hesitant to stay at this hotel after reading the previous reviews. When we got there, we were not too dissapointed. The hotel really is not that bad. It could use some updating in the rooms, but all in all it was really not that bad. The rooms were not spotless, but I brought cleaning products and cleaned it myself, which I would reccomend. The room was also a little small and the shower was tiny. The pools were great and the location was also nice. We were out for most of the day and night and only really used the room to shower and sleep, so it served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Room over a night club”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a weekend trip to OC. We made reservations three days ahead of time for this hotel. Our room was ready when we arrived, room #116 by the pool. This was not the room we were told about when we booked, but thought "No big deal". The room was very small and the bathroom was old and cruddy. Again, "No big deal", we wanted to get to the pool and the beach. We went out to dinner and returned around 11:00 pm to a rock concert in our room. The floor and walls were literally shaking from the loud obnoxious noise coming from below us. I immediately called the front desk to ask what was going on. It seems that the hotel rents the basement to a bar that hosts live heavy metal bands! I was told that the band would be playing until 2:00 am! We had just driven eight hours, getting up at 3:00 am so that we would arrive in OC by the afternoon and were completely exhausted. The desk clerk said there were no more rooms available that night to move us into, but that the next day there were openings. The music continued well after 2:00 am, so I called the desk again. The desk clerk had to call the OC police to get the bar to stop the music, which finally subsided around 3:00 am. There went the idea of going to bed early so that we could enjoy a full next day! Apparently this loud music can be heard in both room 115 and 116, and possibly other rooms in the vicinity, so beware! We were never told at check-in about the possible loud music. The desk clerk said the hotel usually saves those rooms for walk-ins, which we were not!. The hotel did lower the rate $50 for that night and moved us to another room the next day, but that did not make up for a night of lost sleep. Also, the manager was never available when we went to the front desk. Find another place to stay! This hotel is only concerned about renting rooms, not customer satisfaction!

Reviews.Title: “New room--1 star, hospitality 1 star, overall 1 star”
Reviews.Author: hogwild19464
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Ocean City MD before and loved it, our experience at Days Inn was the worst, We rented one of the new Studio Rooms, there was liquid nails stuck to everything, patches on the walls and the tub had glue or something stuck in it. We had no curtains, The front desk was terrible, they lied over and over, They told us no manager was on sight, walking to our room we saw the manager. They said Curtains would be in on Wed, no curtains, they said there were safes in the room, no safe, when we booked the place they said the rooms were Oceanfront, they were oceanview, If you did not make reservations yet, stay at the Grand right next door or stay at the Holiday Inn. We will never stay at a Days Inn again, I feel they stole our money from us. There are much nicer places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I pictured from the web site”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my first trip to Ocean City and was very dissapointed with this hotel. Our room was not very clean when we first got there. My wife brought cleaners just in case so all of us pitched in and gave the room a good cleaning. The place is being remodeled but i think the contractors are making a bigger mess then is already there. At the price we paid I could have stayed twice as long in Disney in a clean roomy hotel. As for the staff I have to say they were great. They were very helpful even though there wasnt too much they could do. I dont think I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great access to the beach!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, three-year-old daughter, and I just got back from our stay at the Day's Inn in Ocean City, MD. I had read many reviews of various hotels, so I was a bit nervous about the accommodations. In spite of this, I was pleased overall by our stay at the Day's Inn. The exterior of the hotel is being remodeled, and on the last two days of our stay, there were constructions workers hammering, sawing, and nailing throughout the day. This did not really bother us because we were out for most of the day anyway. However, if you have small children who need to nap in quiet, this could be a problem until the construction is completely finiished. However, the outside of the hotel is in dire need of repair, so I believe the work is essential. I am not sure why they decided to have the workers complete these jobs during the peak vacation season, but nevertheless, it is manageable. The room we picked had an oceanfront view, and when we stepped out onto our private balcony, I was very impressed. Being able to sit on the balcony and watch the waves and the people passing by was really relaxing. Plus, all we had to do was walk a few steps outside of the hotel and we were directly on the beach! In my opinion, this hotel has an ideal location because it is on the boardwalk, but not in the crowded section, and it has easy access to the beach as well. The room itself was fairly clean and neat, albeit small, and the cleaning woman we had did an OK job. I must admit one feature of the room that I really liked was the locking safe, which made me feel more confident when I left the room. My young daughter and I went in all three of the pools at the hotel, and we enjoyed all of them. None were extremely crowded, so we didn't have to rush. I would definitely consider staying in this hotel again next year when all of the construction is complete (hopefully!) or I would stay next door at the Grand Hotel. This being my first time to Ocean City, Maryland, I must say that I had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been much worse...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is adding floors, so our room was surrounded by a major construction site with debris falling from above. Loud, dirty, not to mention dangerous, especially for my young children. The management obviously knew of this but didn't bother to mention any of it, even after we checked in. Rooms were old and grungy and customer service was severely lacking. Upon check-in, only one bed had pillows on it, and it took 2 phone calls plus a trip to the front desk over a 6 hour period to get pillows. Staff was indifferent to problems. Three other families in my group all had problems with the cleanliness of their rooms and poor customer service. Totally avoid this place.
